folder.fullPath: Phase 1/Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel

testCase.folder: Phase 1/Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel
testCase.name: FCBK-22 | Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel | View Validation
testCase.objective: Test case to validate the  viewing access of a valid DCE User
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.\

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And the Recommendation tab must be active/clickable

testCase.folder: Phase 1/Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel
testCase.name: FCBK-22 | Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel | View Validation
testCase.objective: To validate access to Recommendation Tab for an unauthorized user
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user doesn't have valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must not be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel

testCase.name: FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Recommendation Display Card for completed projects
testCase.objective: Validate that Recommendation display cards for the completed campaigns must be displayed on clicking on Recommendations tab
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And on clicking Recommendation Tab User must be able to see Recommendation display cards for the completed campaigns And each card must display name , cover image, observed primary metric, duration , Status,Â media platorm as Facebook of/for the project And All , Base , Saved, Launched Project tab must be present to categorize the recommendations based on their status And search functionality must be present And pagination must be present with each page consisting of 10 recommendations. And Color legend to differentiate between base project and recommendation must be present below tabs

testCase.name: FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | "Recommendation Not Available" message in case of no completed projects
testCase.objective: Validate Recommendation tab Landing page behaviour in case there isn't a completed project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And User has valid roles and authorization And there isn't any campaign associated to user in completed state And user clicks on Recommendation tab on left pane Then user must be able to see the message "There are no Recommendations available yet. Recommendation will be become available once a Project is completed"

testCase.name: FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Selection of a card and Navigation to next page on clicking on card
testCase.objective: Validate display card is in selected state after the click and click on Next button redirects to Rules Review Screen
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And a completed campaign with recommendations is associated to user in completed state And user clicks on Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And display cards for the recommendation is present in un selected state Then if user clicks on next button without selecting next, error message must be displayed And when user clicks on any card, user must be redirected to top 6 videos page

testCase.name: FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Recommendations Not Available for Completed Campaigns
testCase.objective: Validate Recommendation tab Landing page behaviour in case there isn't any recommendation for any of the completed campaigns
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And User has valid roles and authorization And there isn't any campaign associated to user in completed state And user clicks on Recommendation tab on left pane Then user must be able to see the message "There are no Recommendations available yet."

testCase.name: FCBK-24 | Review Rules Recommendation for selected campaign | Header and Banner Section
testCase.objective: Validate content and UI attributes of header and banner at Selected Campaign's Rules Recommendation page
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And user has campaign recommendation card(diplay card) under Reco tab When user selects Project to complete Recommendation Review and clicks on "Next" button Then user lands on screen - "Review Rules Recommendation" And header on the screen must show the navigation path :- Campaign List > {Client Name} > Recommendations > Rules And on the rightmost top {Client Name}:Facebook followed by text "Selected Project" and cover image of the client must be shown And the alignment and styling must be as per the wireframes

testCase.name: FCBK-24 | Base recommendation | Filter and top 6 video thumbnail section
testCase.objective: Validate Filter and Video thumbnail section
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given a user logs in with valid access and authorization And user lands on "Review Rules Recommendation" by clicking on one of campaigns under Recommendation tab Then user must be able to see filter section (media sets and configurations) at the top under the heading - "Filter:" And already selected values(default values) must be populated under filter set And the other filter values must be available under respective dropdown And filter section must be followed by top 6 videos corresponding to the filters applied, as thumbnails in a row And the videos must be arranged as per descending VTR value And by default first video will have tick mark but none of the videos must be selected state And on changing the filter values the subsequent videos pane must be updated And Users will be able to select any of the thumbnails by clicking on it

testCase.name: FCBK-24 | Review Rules Recommendation for selected campaign | Video Player and overview section
testCase.objective: Validate video player and overview section of the selected video is present
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given a user logs in with valid access and authorization And user lands on "Review Rules Recommendation" by clicking on one of campaigns under Recommendation tab And user must be able to see and play selected video in video player below the top videos And the video player design must be as per wireframes And user must be able to control volume of the video, download the video , view picture in picture, seek

testCase.name: FCBK-24 | Review Rules Recommendation for selected campaign | Next button
testCase.objective: Validate functionality of the Next button
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given a user logs in with valid access and authorization And user lands on "Review Rules Recommendation" by clicking on one of campaigns under Recommendation tab And user selects the video for which rules are to be modified Then Overview of the selected reco must be shown displaying predicted VTR , inactivated rules, additional videos created And video player must be shown with play , volume, settings , zoom options And "CONTINUE WITH THIS RECOMMENDATION" button is shown And on clicking on "CONTINUE WITH THIS RECOMMENDATION" button user is redirected to next page wherein changes in rules are displayed which resulted in the created recommendation

testCase.name: FCBK-25 | Review Rules Recommendation for selected campaign | Change Filters
testCase.objective: Validate that on changing filters, the video carousel is updated
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommendation tab--> Rules Recmmendation When user clicks on the Project to complete Recommendation Review and clicks on "Next" button Then user must be able to change the default filters And on changing the filter the videos must be updated And in base project first one must have a green tick to denote it as the default selected And on changing filter, overview must not be shown And for saved recommendation, the video which user has selected must be shown(with green tick sign) along with 5 others under respective filters

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation | Rules Screen UI
testCase.objective: Validate  the User Interface of the page
testCase.precondition:
• User is logged in.
  • User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  • User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  • User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco When user selects the video for which rules are to be modified and clicks on "Next Button" Then user lands on screen with the rules section wherein all rules are listed and on the right side, stats must be displayed along with the original video And user must have access to 1. add rules, 2. delete rules, 3. edit rules And user must have access to 1. Download Version List, 2. View Version List And Rules review module will have each rule listed which has either been added or removed or edited listed down with icons indicating the same And Rules review module will also display total number of rules, active rules,inactive rules, edited rules And No of Additional videos that would be created if that set of rules recommendation is applied must be displayed And the predicted VTR as per the rules set must be displayed And CTA to download version list in CSV / JSON format must be present And CTA to view version list must be present And filters/ media sets and configuration pertaining to the recommendation must be displayed and top with respective header And "SEND FOR APPROVAL" button must be enabled And "SAVE RECOMMENDATION" button must be enabled And "Previous" button must be present to enable user to navigate back to state where user can view top 6 videos

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation | Rules Section
testCase.objective: To validate the rules display section
testCase.precondition:
• User is logged in.
  • User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  • User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  • User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco When user selects the video for which rules are to be modified and clicks on "Next Button" Then user lands on screen with the video and details of changes/steps made to the existing Rules to create the reco And number of "Rules" , "Active Rules", "Inactive Rules", "Edited Rules","Predicted VTR" ,"Additional videos created" must be displayed with correct values And Legends for the rules action (Original, Relaxed, Edited) must be displayed above the rules set

testCase.name: FCBK-28 | Selected Video Recommendation | Add Rule Query Builder UI
testCase.objective: Validate Rule query builder is available to user to add new rules to recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Add Rule"button in Rules section Then a query builder to add rule with blank dropdowns to select the values and create the rule. And Query builder will use categories setup while creating the project as value to create or edit rules. And Query builder will follow "IF value is THIS, THEN value should INCLUDE/EXCLUDE THAT value" structure with multiple IF statements and THAT statements nested with AND/OR. And "SAVE" button and "Close" icon must be enabled for the query build

testCase.name: FCBK-28 | Selected Video Recommendation | Add and Save New Rule via Query Builder
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to add and save new rule to the recommendation via Query Builder
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Add Rule" And user makes changes in the query builder to add rule with media sets and configurations And clicks on "SAVE" button Then user they will be taken back to the screen where they clicked the edit rule or add rule CTA And the new rule must be added to the existing set in rule module at top And number of "Rules ", "Active Rules" must change

testCase.name: FCBK-354 | Selected Video Recommendation | Remove Existing Rule
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to remove an existing rule to recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Edit Rule" icon,query builder modal must open with rules detail And when user clicks on "Relax" button, then rule must be deleted Then the new rule must be updated in the existing set in rule module and deleted icon must be associated to the deleted rule And number of "Active Rules" ,"Inactive Rules","Additional Video would be created", "Predicted VTR" must change

testCase.name: FCBK-354 | Selected Video Recommendation | Edit Active rule
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to edit and reapply the deleted rule
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Selected Video Reco to change rules for When user clicks on "Edit Rule" icon against the rules, then query builder for the rule must open with the details of rules applied And "Relax" and "Save" CTA must be present Then user must be able to change the rule defination and save the edit by clicking on SAVE button And number of "Edited rules" must change And the statement for the edited rule must change in rule module

testCase.name: FCBK-28 | Selected Video Recommendation | Add and Not Save New Rule via Query Builder
testCase.objective: Validate that no change occurs to rule set if user add new rule in Query Builder but doesn't save
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Add Rule" And user makes changes in the query builder to add rule with media sets and configurations And user closes the query builder without saving their work Then user they will be taken back to the screen where they clicked the edit rule or add rule CTA And the new rule must not be added to the existing set in rule module at top And number of "Rules Applied" , "Video would be created" ,"Predicted VTR" must not change

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation | Edit and Save existing Rule
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to edit and save new rule to the recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Edit Rule" icon of the rule to be changed Then a query builder to add rule with dropdowns populated with existing rule media set and configuration And Query builder will use categories setup while creating the project as value to edit rules furthur And Query builder will follow "IF value is THIS, THEN value should INCLUDE/EXCLUDE THAT value" structure with multiple IF statements and THAT statements nested with AND/OR. And "SAVE" button must be enabled for the query build And user makes changes in the query builder to add rule with media sets and configurations And clicks on "SAVE" button Then user they will be taken back to the screen where they clicked the edit rule or add rule CTA And the new rule must be added to the existing set in rule module And number of "Edited Rules" must change

testCase.name: FCBK-309 | Selected Video Recommendation | Download version list
testCase.objective: FCBK-309 | Selected Video Recommendation | Download version list
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User is reviewing rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked on Version List or Download version list CTA

testScript.details: Given Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Selected Video Reco to change rules for When user clicks on "Download Version" button Then option to download in CSV or JSON format should be available And user will be download the file in selected format post selection And CSV or JSON will get downloaded within the same browser window And "Download Version" button must be available for recommendation in all states And user must be able to download file from any browser And hand icon must be present on hovering over the button

testCase.name: FCBK-30 | Selected Video Recommendation | Save Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to save the recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User is reviewing rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked on Save Recommendation CTA

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user edits rule and clicks on SAVE RECOMMENDATION button Then a dialog box prompting user to provide name to Recommendation must appear And Pop up window will allow user to input a name (CHAR LIMIT TO BE FINALIZED BY UX, SPECIAL CHARACTERS ALLOWED?). And name will be a mandatory field and will automatically have ":Recommendation" appended at the end to differentiate its display card from others on Recommendations landing page And on clicking on SAVE button, the Recommendations must be saved with the assigned name And user will be taken back to screen where they clicked on Save Recommendation CTA And Version history must be updated

testCase.name: FCBK-30 | Selected Video Recommendation | Save Recommendation without name
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to save the recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User is reviewing rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked on Save Recommendation CTA

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for And user edits rule and clicks on SAVE RECOMMENDATION button And a dialog box prompting user to provide name to Recommendation must appear And user clicks on save button without entering the name Then user must be prompted with the error message - "Name is mandatory"

testCase.name: FCBK-30 | Selected Video Recommendation | Close "Save Recommendation" dialog box without saving
testCase.objective: Validate that recommendation won't be saved if user clicks on close button on save recommendation dialog box
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User is reviewing rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked on Save Recommendation CTA

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for And user edits rule and clicks on SAVE RECOMMENDATION button And a dialog box prompting user to provide name to Recommendation must appear And user clicks on close button after entering the name Then recommendation will not be saved and user will be taken back to screen where they clicked on Save Recommendation CTA

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Send for approval after saving
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to send recommendation for approval after saving it
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for And user has saved the reco And user clicks on SEND FOR APPROVAL button Then A dialog box prompting user to provide email of the approver must appear And the dialog box must have checkbox which is by default NOT checked to alert when videos have been approved And on clicking on SEND button, the email with the link to approve the reco must be sent to the assigned approver And the recommendation card must appear on the landing page of the Recommendation tab with flag as "Approval Pending" and tag as "RECOMMENDATION" And on the rules screen, CANCEL APPROVAL button must appear and SAVE and SEND FOR APPROVAL button must disappear And text "Approval request sent to approver at timestamp" must be shown on edit rules page And on the version list screen also, text "Approval request sent to approver at timestamp" must be shown And no furthur changes must be allowed on the recommendation

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Resend for Approval button enabled
testCase.objective: Validate that Resend for Approval button is enabled after sending the  recommendation for approval
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And user tries to Add New Rule or make any changes Then toast/pop up with message "Approval is Pending You can't make any changes to this recommendation" must appear And in the footer notification/text must appear stating "Approval sent DATETIME to APPROVER'S_NAME" And RESEND FOR APPROVAL button must be present and enabled

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Resend for Approval
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to send recommendation for approval after saving it
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And user clicks on RESEND FOR APPROVAL button Then User must be prompted with dialog box again to add approver's name And on confirming a new approval request must be sent via email to the approver And Version history must be updated

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Cancel Approval Request
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to cancel recommendation approval request
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And CANCEL APPROVAL REQUEST button must be present and enabled on the Rules Screen And user clicks on CANCEL button Then a dialog box to enable user to change the approver or CANCEL the request must open And when user clicks on button "No Thanks, Just Cancel the request", SAVE and SEND FOR APPROVAL button must be enabled And User must be able to perform changes to the rules And the link sent to earlier approver must not be valid

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Send Approval Request after cancelling prior request
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to send recommendation for approval again after cancelling the previous request
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. User has cancelled the approval request

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And CANCEL APPROVAL REQUEST button must be present and enabled on the Rules Screen And user clicks on CANCEL button Then SAVE and SEND FOR APPROVAL button must be enabled And User must be able to perform changes to the rules And User must able to send approval request

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Edits not allowed on Recommendation with approval pending state
testCase.objective: Validate that Edits not allowed on  Recommendation with approval pending state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And user clicks on RESEND FOR APPROVAL button Then A dialog box prompting user to provide name to Recommendation must appear And user must be able to resend the request And the project must still be flagged as "Approval Pending" with updated timestamp And project must still be ineligible for further changes And Edit CTA must be unclickable

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Version List | Approval Pending Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to view version list for the Recommendation in approval pending state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approval Pending" state to review the project And user clicks on Version List Then user must be able to see all the version list pertaining to the Recommendation And user must able to download the version list as CSV and JSON And user must be shown the timestamp at which Reco was sent and the approver's name to whom it was sent And user must be able to view filters associated with the reco and change filter and view results accordingly And user must be able to videos associated and also render other videos And user must have option RENDER ALL And all videos must info icon and Rendered video must have play option And text "Approval Request sent to approver name at timestamp" must be dislayed

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Rule Based Recommendation Landing Page | Approved Recommendation Card
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to view approved recommendation display card on Rule Based Recommendation landing page
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And Approver has approved the recommendation Then Recommendation must be flagged with "APPROVED" state And the recommendation card on UI must show Approved sign And "LAUNCH AS PROJECT" button must be enabled and shown for the Approved Recommendation on edit rules page

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Version List | Approved Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to view version list for the Recommendation in approved state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation request

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approved" state to review the project And user clicks on Version List Then user must be able to see all the version list pertaining to the Recommendation And user must able to download the version list as CSV and JSON And user must be shown the timestamp at which Reco was approved and the approver's name And user must be able to view filters associated with the reco And user must be able to videos associated and also render other videos And user must have option RENDER ALL And all videos must info icon and Rendered video must have play option

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Approved Recommendation | Save Recommendation as a Project option Availability
testCase.objective: Validate that user has access/option to save the approved recommendation as a project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And user has associated approved Recommendation And user clicks on "SAVE AS PROJECT" button Then A dialog box appears to confirm if project is to be saved with "NO,THANKS NOT YET" and "SAVE AS PROJECT" button And "SAVE AS PROJECT" button must be selected/highlighted

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Approved Recommendation | Launch Recommendation as a Project
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to launch the approved recommendation as a project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicks on "Launch AS PROJECT" on recommendation card with "Approved" state Then user is redirected into details of the projects And on edit rules page, "LAUNCH AS PROJECT" CTA must be present with text "Approved By Approver Timestamp" And on clicking on th CTA , user must be prompted with confirmation dialog box And in case user cancels, she lands on the same screen with "LAUNCH AS PROJECT" CTA And in case user clicks on confirm, a new project is created under the campaign with given name and configurations and rules as saved by the user And on the edit rules screen CTA "GO TO PROJECT " must be shown And on the landing page the recommendation card must show the label "LAUNCHED AS PROJECT"

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Approved Recommendation | Go To Project option available on opening recommendation Launched As Project
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to view "Go To Project" button on opening recommendation which is Launched  As Project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation
  7. User has saved the recommendation as project

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And User has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And User has associated Recommendation saved as project And Users clicks on saved recommendation card Then User must be able to see all the rules along with toast message "You can't make any changes anymore " And in the footer tags - "Approved" and "Saved As A Project" must be presesnt with "GO TO PROJECT" button

testCase.name: FCBK-31 | Approved Recommendation | Project View of Recommendation Launched As Project
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to navigate to Project view of the recommendation Launched As Project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation
  7. User has saved the recommendation as project

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And User has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And User has associated Recommendation saved as project And Users clicks on saved recommendation card And User clicks on "GO TO PROJECT" button Then User is navigated to Project View/Draft View

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Version List screen for recommendation to be approved
testCase.objective: Validate that approver is able to view the version list screen for the approval requests
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has associated Recommendation to approve And Users has opened the link to the approval request for the recommendation Then user lands on the recommendation version list screen Then User must be able to see all the version list pertaining to the Recommendation And User must able to download the version list as CSV and JSON And APPROVE button(green color) must be available to the User And user must be able to view filters associated with the reco And User must be able to videos associated and also render other videos

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Expiry Time for the recommendation to approve must be indefinate
testCase.objective: Validate the functionality if recommendation link is opened after couple of days
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request
  5. Approver hasn't approved the request within stipulated time

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And User has associated Recommendation to approve Then the link should remain active indefinately

testCase.name: FCBK-59 | Insights | Insights should be fetched and stored for completed projects
testCase.objective: Validate the insights are fetched and stored for completed projects
testCase.precondition:
1. Completed projetcs are present in DCE database
  2. Automation task to schedule insights pull from FB is scheduled

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state And its insights have not been pulled from Facebook Then Automation Engine will post a request to FB to fetch the details with date param And the result/insights of completed project must be stored in the DB for the given date range And all the fields must be correctly synced

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Approved Recommendations Version List screen
testCase.objective: Validate the version list screen display for the approved recommendation for the approver
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request
  5. Approver has approved the request within stipulated time

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation And User has associated approved Recommendation And Users clicks on Recommendation Then User must be able to see all the version list pertaining to the Recommendation And User must able to download the version list as CSV and JSON And APPROVED tag must be shown to the User And user must be able to view filters associated with the reco And User must be able to videos associated and also render other videos

testCase.name: FCBK-59 | Insights | Retry to fetch Insights for completed projects
testCase.objective: Validate that project owner should be notified via email in case insights pull for completed project has failed
testCase.precondition:
1. Completed projetcs are present in DCE database
  2. Automation task to schedule insights pull from FB is scheduled
  3. Automation task has failed to fetch insights

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state And its insights have not been pulled from Facebook And Automation Engine has posted a request to FB to fetch the details with date param And the task has failed/unable to pull data Then project owner should be notified via email.

testCase.name: FCBK-60 | Insights | Extract project report at ad level in a campaign
testCase.objective: Validate the project report at ad level must be sent to DCE platform
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task to schedule insights pull from FB is scheduled

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state And its insights have not been pulled from Facebook Then Automation Engine will post a request to FB to fetch the details with date param And the result/insights of completed project must be stored in the DB for the given date range and other agreed upon parama And all the insights must be reported at ad level

testCase.name: FCBK-61 | Insights | Facebook data enrichment
testCase.objective: Validate the insights data is enriched  with information stored in DCE
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task to schedule insights pull from FB is scheduled
  3.  Insights are stored in DB
  4.  FB Creative IDs are present in DCE db

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB Then mapping FB creative ID to DCE permutations must be done And ID to map category and content from DCE to media performance in FB must be done And creative IDs must be matched and stored in DB

testCase.name: FCBK-65 | Rule Based Reco Analysis and ranking | Identify the next best inventory/asset/category combination
testCase.objective: Validate that  all the  inventory/asset/category combination is ranked based on predictive ranking system
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB And Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB Then For each possible combination in DCE Project, a predicted Ranking score should be available And all combination is ranked

testCase.name: FCBK-66 | Rule Based Reco Analysis and ranking | Isolate new permutation/combination
testCase.objective: Validate that new permutation/combination created are unique
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB
  4. new recommendations are generated

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB And Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB And Based on the category and content combination new permutations are highlighted Then the new permutations should be unique

testCase.name: FCBK-67 | Rule Based Reco Analysis and ranking | Identify Rules
testCase.objective: Validate that new permutation/combination created are unique
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB
  4. new permutations/combinations are generated

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB And Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB And Based on the category and content combination unique permutations are highlighted Then rules for the combinations must be identified

testCase.name: FCBK-68 | Rule Based Reco Analysis and ranking | Generate new permuations
testCase.objective: Validate that new permutations must be generated based on new rules
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB
  4. new rule combinations are generated

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB And Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB And Based on the category and content combination unique permutations are highlighted and violated rules are removed Then From the new rules combination new permutations must be generated And These permutations should be ready for rendering and should be rendered on demand. And DCE Project owner should receive email and there should be a notification in the platform And the new generated permutations should be ranked from the highest to the lowest

testCase.name: FCBK-69 | Rule Based Reco Analysis and ranking | Rank new permuations
testCase.objective: Validate that new permutations are ranked
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB
  4. new rule combinations are generated
  5. New permutations are generated based on rules

testScript.details: Given a project is in completed state and insights are pulled and stored in DB And Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB And Based on the category and content combination unique permutations are highlighted and violated rules are removed Then From the new rules combination new permutations must be generated And the new generated permutations should be ranked from the highest to the lowest

testCase.name: FCBK-354 | Selected Video Recommendation | Remove Child rule of Existing Parent-Child Rule set
testCase.objective: Validate that user is able to remove an existing rule to recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for When user clicks on "Edit Rule" icon for a rule with parent-child relationship and deletes the child condition Then the newrule must be updated in the existing set in rule module and edited icon must be associated to the deleted rule And number of "Edited rules" must change

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Edits not allowed on Recommendation with approved state
testCase.objective: Validate that Edits not allowed on  Recommendation with approval pending state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Approved" state to review the project Then the project must still be flagged as "Approved" with updated timestamp And project must be ineligible for further changes And Edit CTA must be unclickable

testCase.name: FCBK-541 | Selected Video Recommendation and Rules | Edits must be allowed on Recommendation with Rejected state
testCase.objective: Validate that Edits not allowed on  Recommendation with approval pending state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Recommedation tab --> Rules Navigation and clicked on recommendation card with "Rejected" state to review the project Then the project must still be flagged as "Approved" with updated timestamp And Edit CTA must be clickable And user must be able to add/edit/delete the rule

testCase.name: FCBK-24 | Saved Recommendation | Filter and top 6 video thumbnail section
testCase.objective: Validate Filter and Video thumbnail section
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on one of the display cards for the projects which have status as completed and for which rules recommendations are ready to be reviewed in recommendations tab

testScript.details: Given a user logs in with valid access and authorization And user lands on "Review Rules Recommendation" by clicking on one of campaigns under Recommendation tab Then user must be able to see filter section (media sets and configurations) at the top under the heading - "Filter:" And already selected values(default values) must be populated under filter set And the other filter values must be available under respective dropdown And filter section must be followed by top 6 videos corresponding to the filters applied, as thumbnails in a row And the video which user has selected must be shown(with green tick sign) along with 5 others under respective filters And on clicking on the video updated by user, corresponding stats must be shown in overview section

testCase.folder: Phase 1/Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel
testCase.name: FCBK-22 | Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel | 0 recommendations
testCase.objective: Test case to validate the  viewing access of a valid DCE User
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign. (exact role needs to be named, Fahad or Tej to provide details)

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has no recommendations Then user must be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And on opening the tab, user must see the message - "You have no recommendation"

testCase.name: FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Recommendation Display Card | Base Project
testCase.objective: Validate that Recommendation display cards for the completed campaigns must be displayed on clicking on Recommendations tab
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And on clicking Recommendation Tab User must be able to see Base Project And base project card must display name , cover image, predicted VTR, duration ,Â media platorm as Facebook of/for the project And blue line at the bottom must be present to denote base project And text "Base Project" should be there And there shouldn't be copy/delete button

  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.

testCase.objective: Validate that Recommendation display cards for the completed campaigns must be displayed on clicking on Recommendations tab

  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state with recommendations And user clicks Recommendation -> Rules tab in the left navigation panel Then user must land on rules based recommendation landing page And tabs - All, Base Projects, Saved Recommendations, Launched Recommendations And on clicking on All tabs, user must be able to view all recommendations And on clicking on Base Projects, user must be able to view all the base projects And on clicking on Saved Recommendations, user must be able to view all the projects in saved, approval pending, approved , rejected state And on clicking on Launched Recommendations, user must be able to view all the recommendations which are launched as projects And search on each tab must provide results pertaining to the tab which is active And pagination must work within each tab

testCase.objective: FCBK-309 | Selected Video Recommendation | Download version list for 0 additional videos

  4. User is reviewing rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked on Save Recommendation CTA

testScript.details: Given user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Video to change rules for And the project is sent for approval or in state after it, SAVE button must not be visible And if the project is in Rejected state, the SAVE button must be enabled

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Over view of the Approver view
testCase.objective: Validate the approver view and overview of the functionality
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request
  5. Approver has approved the request within stipulated time

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link Then user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And user must be able to view filters associated with the reco and for each filters the permutations sent for approval Then User must be able to see the stats for each filter And User must able to download the version list as CSV and JSON And User must be able to see the videos associated and also render other videos And for each config, approver must have option to APPROVE Version and REJECT VERSION And APPROVE ALL button must be present to approve all the config

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Reject a config
testCase.objective: Validate the approver is able to reject a config with valid reason
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request
  5. Approver has approved the request within stipulated time

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link And user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And for a config if user clicks on REJECT VERSION CTA, Then a dialog box must appear with config displayed in heading prompting to give reason for rejection (limit of 250 char) And user must have option to cancel the rejection or save it And in case user clicks on cross CTA or cancel cta on dialog box, the config should be in default state And in case user saves the rejection, user should land back to the screen And REJECT VERSION cta should be disabled from any click And APPROVE VERSION cta must be clickable in case user wants to approve the rejected config And no of config confirmed and info about no of rejected and approved config must be updated And the label "Rejectd config" must come for the config

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Approve a config
testCase.objective: Validate the approver is able to approve config with valid reason
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link And user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And for a config if user clicks on APPROVE VERSION CTA, Then config must be approved And APPROVE VERSION cta should be disabled from any click And REJECT VERSION cta must be clickable in case user wants to reject the approved config And no of config confirmed and info about no of rejected and approved config must be updated And the label "Approved config" must come for the config

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Approve ALL
testCase.objective: Validate the approver is able to approve config with valid reason
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link And user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And for a config if user clicks on APPROVE ALL CTA, Then dialog box prompting user to confirm approve all config And in case user clicks on CONFIRM button, then all config must be approved irrespective of his previous work And recommendation should move to Approved state And mail must be sent to the user, project owner that the project is approved And APPROVE VERSIONS, REJECT VERSIONS must be unclickable and disabled

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Complete the request
testCase.objective: Validate the Complete the request
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link And user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And if user has actioned on each config, and after taking action on the last config Then the COMPLETE APPROVAL REQUEST pop up must come automatically And the info about the configurations - total count , no of approved , no of rejected configs and reasons for each rejection must be displayed And if user clicks on cross or cancel button, user must land on the version list screen and request must not be sent to backend And in case user clicks on cancel/cross button, the CTA - COMPLETE APPROVAL REQUEST must appear on the screen in green And in case user clicks on confirm, the config must be approved/rejected as per user's action And in case user confirms user must land on version list with all CTAs in unclickable state And mail must be sent to user in case of subscription and project owner And the state of the project should be changed from Recommendation saved to either approved/ rejected

testCase.name: FCBK-522 | Approver | Complete the request in case any of the config is rejected
testCase.objective: Validate the Complete the request in case any of the config is rejected
testCase.precondition:
1. User/Approver is logged in.
  2. User has received the request to approve the recommendation for a campaign
  3. User has been authorized to view and approve the recommendation
  4. User has received the mail with the link to approve the request

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization as an APPROVER And User has clicked on Approve Version button on approval mail link And user lands on screen to approve/reject the request And if user has rejected any/all config Then on COMPLETING APPROVAL REQUEST mail must be sent to user in case of subscription and project owner stating that project is rejected with details of configs rejected and associated reasons And the state of the project should be changed from Recommendation saved to rejected

testCase.name: FCBK-924 | Approved Recommendation | Recommendation Launched AS Project | Sending data to FB
testCase.objective: Validate that data must be sent to FB for the launched recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has launched the recommendation as project Then new permutations based on the rules of each config of the launched project must be uploaded to FB And project must be set live in DCE And user with media settings edit/add access must be Prompted to visit Facebook Business Manager and add/amend any additional settings

testCase.name: Validate API To fetch all recommendation and configurations for selected project
testCase.objective: To verify that Content-Campaign-Project-Recommendations  API   is fetching all recommendations and configuration for the selected project
