step.testData: http://dce-api-spi.zenithmedia.io/uat/api/content/assembly/recommendations/projects/5f9151256e42fe00219486fa/recommendeds/5ff82e917d80ce001ddf6c71/launch-recommendation-as-project

testCase.name: FCBK-911 | Duration Based Recommendation | Label for Duration Based Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate the label is present on campaign and project with Duration Based Recommendation
testCase.precondition: 1. As a logged in authorized campaign manager with access to campaign(s) and project(s) within that campaign, I should be able to review duration based recommendations available for a project in detail.

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has access to campiagn having projects with duration based recommenation Then User must be able to see the label "Recommendation Available" on the campaign card And on navigating inside the campaign, User must be able to see the label "Recommendation Available" on the project card haiving recommendation And on clicking on the project User will be redirected to recommendations review screen where he will be able to browse through different combinations of placement name (via drop down) and configurations (will change as per selected placement name)

testCase.name: FCBK-909 | Duration Based Recommendation | over view of Duration Based Recommendation page
testCase.objective: Validate the overview of Duration Based Recommendation page
testCase.precondition:
1. As a logged in authorized campaign manager with access to campaign(s) and project(s) within that campaign, I should be able to review duration based recommendations available for a project in detail.
  2. Pre condition:
    1. User is logged in.
    2. User has clicked on recommendation tab within a project overview section.

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to duration based recommendation page Then he will be able to browse through different combinations of placement name (via drop down) and configurations (will change as per selected placement name) And The recommended video will then have corresponding video player with the video loaded. Along with the video player a separate module - "overview of recommendation" will get displayed. This module will display the predicted KPI for the video, duration of the video. This module will also show how many seconds of video was edited out as well as the number of pillars(assets) were edited out. A Push live CTA will also be available for user in this module. And Push live CTA will be disabled for the placement name and config combination for which the recommended video has been made live. And Alongside "overview of recommendation" module, details about current live video will also be displayed - achieved KPI (calculated at the point of time user is at this screen and will be updated every time user visits the screen), duration, drop off rate (calculated at the point of time user is at this screen and will be updated every time user visits the screen), pillars (assets) used to create the original video. These values will be provided via an API. (NEED TO KNOW HOW FREQUENTLY RECOMMENDATIONS WILL GET GENERATED). Generation and validation of the values is not in scope of this story. And Based on the pillars used for creating the original video and pillars edited out of the recommended video, thumbnail of each asset will be shown with play button. Below these thumbnails duration of each Pillar will be displayed. clicking on any pillar/asset will play the video in a pop up. Assets which are edited out of recommendation will be marked separately as per the wireframe.

testCase.name: FCBK-909 | Duration Based Recommendation | frequency of Duration Based Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate that new  recommendation must be available at an interval of 24 hrs
testCase.precondition: 1. As a logged in authorized campaign manager with access to campaign(s) and project(s) within that campaign, I should be able to review duration based recommendations available for a project in detail.

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to duration based recommendation page Then he will be able to view new recommendation at an interval of 24 hrs provided new reco are available

testCase.name: FCBK-909 | Duration Based Recommendation | journey after Duration Based Recommendation is pushed to LIVE
testCase.objective: Validate the  journey after Duration Based Recommendation is pushed to LIVE
testCase.precondition:
1. As a logged in authorized campaign manager with access to campaign(s) and project(s) within that campaign, I should be able to review duration based recommendations available for a project in detail.
  2. Pre condition:
    1. User is logged in.
    2. User has clicked on recommendation tab within a project overview section.

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to duration based recommendation page And user has pushed the recommendation to LIVE Then new videos for the given placement must be push live in FB And PUSH LIVE button must be disabled for the given placement and config value

testCase.name: FCBK-909 | Duration Based Recommendation | historical data on Duration Based Recommendation page
testCase.objective: Validate the historical data on  Duration Based Recommendation page
testCase.precondition:
1. As a logged in authorized campaign manager with access to campaign(s) and project(s) within that campaign, I should be able to review duration based recommendations available for a project in detail.
  2. Pre condition:
    1. User is logged in.
    2. User has clicked on recommendation tab within a project overview section.

testScript.details: Given an user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to duration based recommendation page Then he will be able to browse through different combinations of placement name (via drop down) and configurations (will change as per selected placement name) And user must be able to view previous day data (recommendation and pushed live by whom and at what time) via carousel on overview frame And on the page, date must be shown for which data is shown And on changing the carousel, the pillars and their state(removed or not) must change

testCase.name: FCBK-558 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Search Functionality
testCase.objective: Validate that search functionality on the reco landing page
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state with recommendations And user clicks Recommendation -> Rules tab in the left navigation panel Then user must land on rules based recommendation landing page And search text box must be present on all tabs And user must be able to search based on recommendation name And search textbox must be cleared on switching the tabs

testCase.name: FCBK-558 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Edit and Copy functionality
testCase.objective: 1. Validate that Edit and Copy of the Recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state with recommendations And user clicks Recommendation -> Rules tab in the left navigation panel And on each display cards apart from base project copy and delete button must be present And on clicking on delete button, user must be asked for confirmation, and on confirming project must be deleted And clicking on copy, user must be asked to provide the name for the copy created And a copy of recommenation must be created with the given name, and the state must be 'RECOMMENDATION SAVED' irrespective of the state of the project

testCase.name: FCBK-582 | Selected Video Recommendation | Editing rule to match with the original project
testCase.objective: Validate that effect on the VTR after Editing rule to match with the oroginal project
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Selected Video Reco to change rules for And user has edited the rules and brought the state of each selected video under each filter to the match with the original project Then the predicted VTR should be same as the the original project

testCase.name: FCBK-582 | Selected Video Recommendation | Editing rules and bringing it back to the base project state
testCase.objective: Validate that effect on the VTR after Editing rule and bringing it back to the  base project state
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has selected a video on review rules recommendation screen and has clicked Next.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has navigated to Reco --> Rules Reco --> Project to complete Reco --> Selected Video Reco to change rules for And user has edited the rules and brought the state of each selected video under each filter to the match with the base project Then the predicted VTR should be same as the the base project

testCase.folder: Phase 1/Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel
testCase.name: FCBK-22 | Recommendations tab in the left navigation panel | Highlight Recommendation tab
testCase.objective: To validate Rules recommendation tab is highlighted
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user doesn't have valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must not be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel

testCase.name: FCBK-924 | Approved Recommendation | Recommendation Launched AS Project | Setting project live in DCE
testCase.objective: Validate that launched project is set live in DCE and flag is updated
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has reviewed rules recommendation for a selected video on review rules recommendation screen and has saved the recommendation
  5. User has sent the recommendation for approval
  6. Approver has approved the recommendation

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform with valid roles and authorization And user has launched the recommendation as project Then it must be set live in DCE And flag at entry level of the project must be set to 'NOT VERIFIED'

testCase.name: FCBK-69 | Recommendation generation | UI Flow
testCase.objective: Validate that UI Flow for the recommendation generation
testCase.precondition:
1.  Completed projects are present in DCE database
  2.  Automation task has pulled insights FB 
  3.  Inventory/Asset/category combination for the completed project is stored in DB
  4. new rule combinations are generated
  5. New permutations are generated based on rules

testScript.details: Given a project is in live state, User must be able to complete the project via visiting setup page of the project And on clicking on Complete Project button, a card on reco page must appear with state as calculating And once the process of insights fetch , enrichment and permutaton generation is done, the card should move t0 empty state - base project And out of all the permuatations in each config. top 6 must be shown for each config

testCase.name: Validate API To fetch the history of the duration based recommendations
testCase.objective: To verify that durationRecommendationHistory  API   is fetching Project Specific past recommendation history

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar with no audience version
testCase.objective: Validate header on the audience mapping page
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User is yet to create audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective

testScript.details: Given user has logged in and yet to create the audience version and moved to MAP section Then user would be able to see the header label on control bar with disabled dropdowns

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to access a control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process.
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user will land on Map tab with control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process. And Audience version selector must be present on control bar with version name and no of people associated with it And Geo Location Configurator must be present on control bar with a selected geo location and view all CTA alongside and EDIT CTA And DSP name : Facebook must be shown And Widget for graphical representation of Total audience size for selected audience version must be present with default value(no numbers) and logo(disabled people icon) and info icon And COMPARE must be present that redirects user to COMPARE section

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section | Audience Size Widget
testCase.objective: Validate the behaviour if audience size widget
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user will land on Map tab with control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process. And Widget for graphical representation of Total audience size for selected audience version must be present And By default for an audience version with no facebook target options mapping done, widget would remain inactive. And It will get activated and should be updated dynamically as the user starts the audience mapping

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section | COMPARE CTA
testCase.objective: Validate the behaviour of COMPARE CTA
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user will land on Map tab with control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process. And COMPARE CTA must be present in disabled state And This CTA will remain inactive until user has mapped at least one facebook target option to a business attribute within any target audience and clicked Mark as complete And once the a target audience is marked as complete, this CTA will be clickable And On clicking on it, User will also get redirected to "Compare" section of creator.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-28 | Audience Mapping | Facebook targeting options generation
testCase.objective: Validate facebook targeting options are generated and available to match with business attribute
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab and User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes And User will be able to select a business attribute by clicking it. Then Once a business attribute is selected, user will be shown the corresponding recommended facebook targeting options (25) in middle panel below control bar And User must be able to select any attribute irrespective of previous being marked as complete/associated with targetting option And order of display of FB attribute must be in order of their score And in case both attribute have same score, they must be displayed in alphabetic order

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-28 | Audience Mapping | Custom search for a Facebook targeting option
testCase.objective: Validate Custom search for a facebook targeting option is available to user under Map Section
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab and User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes Then User will be able to select a business attribute by clicking it. And User will be allowed to switch to custom search to manually search for a facebook target option amongst all the target options available at facebook's end. And To initiate the custom search user will need to first click on the search box (by default it would be blank) which would hide the recommended facebook targeting options, type the complete keyword and press enter to see the search results in the middle panel. And If the user again clicks on recommendations, custom search results would be replaced again by list of recommendations (Max number to be displayed?). Search results and state of search box will persist. And if user again clicks on search area user will be able to see the previous search term in the search box with recommendations now replaced by search results.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-31 | Audience Mapping | Drag and drop Facebook target option
testCase.objective: Validate functionality for Drag and drop Facebook target option
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes Then User will be able to drag and drop recommended facebook target option and custom search results in and out of the mapping module (rightmost panel below control bar) And dragged option won't be disabled in middle pane And To remove a recommended facebook target option and custom search results from mapping module user can click on cross icon against it. And if user drags a attribute on an already dropped attribute, the two will now be in a group And each attribute even in group will each have cross button

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-50 | Audience Mapping | Group recommended facebook target option and custom search results
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to Group recommended facebook target option and custom search results using AND/OR relationships
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience and User is now dragging and dropping recommended facebook target option and custom search results into the rightmost panel below control bar. Then User can drag and drop recommended facebook target option and custom search results in mapping module as individual entity or grouped entity. And Recommended facebook target option and custom search results can be kept as grouped entity in mapping module by simply dropping them over an existing individual entity available within mapping module. And By default entities (individual and within grouped) will have OR relationship (even for the grouped entities). This logic can be switched to AND using the on screen controls at each level And Mapping module will not allow Recommended facebook target option and custom search results to be added twice to the same level

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-51 | Audience Mapping | Audience Size - Individual Attribute
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to should be able to see audience size corresponding to each individual and grouped facebook targeting option and for overall target audience
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results
  6. User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors

testScript.details: Given User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors Then System will attempt to get the delivery estimate (reach) of each individual facebook targeting option And This is the estimated_mau returned by FB Delivery Estimate API for the spec consisting just the attributes in that entity (individual) And with addition of each attribute the call will be made and MAU will be updated on UI along with corresponding venn diagram And with deletion of any attribute, the corresponding MAU will be removed from UI

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Audience Version
testCase.objective: 1. Validate audience version section under Control Bar
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user must be able to view Audience version as first section in control bar And i icon must be present before label and on clicking on it, it should open popup displaying And a dropdown must be present to enable user to view different versions available based on the survey And across each version, no of people who particpated must be shown And user must be able to open the dropdown to view other options by clicking anywhere where value and arrow icon is present And on selecting different audience version, the selected value , the heading and no of people on heading also will change And also geographic location and platform size will also update And Audience section below would be updated accordingly

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Only 1 Audience Version Available
testCase.objective: 1. Validate audience version section under Control Bar in case only one option is available
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user must be able to view Audience version as first section in control bar And i icon must be present before label and on clicking on it, it should open popup displaying And a dropdown must be present with only one value And no of people who particpated must match wth one shown below heading

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Audience Version platform size
testCase.objective: 1. Validate audience version  platform size section under Control Bar
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user must be able to view Audience version platform size as third section in control bar And i icon must be present before label and on clicking on it, it should open popup displaying And DSP name : FACEBOOK in caps must be shown along with no of people (returned from FB API) and icon represting size of audience and i icon to display size represntation info And "COMPARE" button must be present to enable user to redirect to compare section

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Audience Version platform size - default sate
testCase.objective: 1. Validate default state of audience version  platform size section under Control Bar
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user must be able to view Audience version platform size as third section in control bar And till none of the audience are mapped, the audience no should be shown as 0 And people icon must be disabled And COMPARE button must be disabled And on changing the audience version, this section must be updated

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Audience Version platform size - Attribute Addition
testCase.objective: 1. Validate audience version platform size section once the attribute is added
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has naviagated to MAP tab and attribute is added for any target audience Then user must be able to view Audience version platform size as third section in control bar with the updated size And audience version size must take in accordance all the targetting audience and not just one in selected state And till the no is fetched , a loader icon must be shown in place of size And color of the people icon on the section must change inaccordance to the legend And adjective describing size of audience eg - SPECIFIC, FAIRLY BROAD, etc must be displayed along side the info icon

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Header
testCase.objective: Validate header on the audience mapping page
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has created audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective

testScript.details: Given user has logged in and has created the audience version and moved to MAP section Then user would be able to see the header with name of objective followed by sheet name And the total no of users who participated in survey with the people icon must be displayed

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section UX
testCase.objective: Validate UX of the control bar section
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user will land on Map tab with control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process. And horizontal white line must be present on top and bottom of the bar And for audience version, a white bold line must be present below the dropdown area and selected value must be bold And for geographic location, a white bold line must be present below the dropdown area and selected value must be bold And for platform size, DSP and FB audience size must be bold And below the control bar label - Map your audience target attributes to Facebook's must be present

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-27 | Audience Mapping | Target Audience Section - Attribute Selected
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to view target audience section for each version and corresponding data for selected attribute
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab and user has selected and audience version to work on Then user would be able to select an attribute to work on for the target version And once selected a right pointing arrow would appear along with attribute and attribute would be in selected state And on mid section where in user can view Facebook attribute or search for more would appear And for max of 25 FB attributes will be shown And in case there's no mapped FB attribute , corresponding message ... would be shown And third column for attributes to be dropped to with name of target audience must be visible with Mark as complete, and SAVE CTA

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Target Audience - MARK as complete
testCase.objective: Validate functionality to mark as complete and effect thereafter
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user would be able to select an attribute to work on for the target version and add FB attribute for the target audience And once user marks a target audience as complete, the target audience will have a Completed label and a tick in green And all the attributes for which one of the atrributes is mapped is also marked ticked in green And all the work so far will be saved

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - InProgress
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to access a control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process.
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab Then user will land on Map tab with control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process. And Audience version selector must be present on control bar with version name and no of people associated with it And Geo Location Configurator must be present on control bar with a selected geo location and view all CTA alongside and EDIT CTA And DSP name : Facebook must be shown And Widget for graphical representation of Total audience size for selected audience version must be present with default value(no numbers) and logo(disabled people icon) and info icon And COMPARE must be present that redirects user to COMPARE section

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-26 | Audience Mapping | Control Bar Section - Geographic location
testCase.objective: 1. Validate audience version section under Control Bar
testCase.precondition:

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-28 | Audience Mapping | Custom search for a commonly used terms
testCase.objective: Validate Custom search for commonly used term is available and valid
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes

testScript.details: Given user has successfully created an audience version and clicked CTA to move to MAP tab and User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes and search Then User will be able to select a business attribute by clicking it. And User will be allowed to switch to custom search to manually search for a facebook target option amongst all the target options available at facebook's end. And To initiate the custom search user will need to first click on the search box (by default it would be blank) which would hide the recommended facebook targeting options, type the complete keyword and press enter to see the search results in the middle panel. And If the user again clicks on recommendations, custom search results would be replaced again by list of recommendations (Max number to be displayed?). Search results and state of search box will persist. And if user again clicks on search area user will be able to see the previous search term in the search box with recommendations now replaced by search results.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-51 | Audience Mapping | Audience Size - Group Attribute
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to should be able to see audience size corresponding to each grouped facebook targeting option and for overall target audience
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results
  6. User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors

testScript.details: Given User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors Then System will attempt to get the delivery estimate (reach) of each grouped facebook targeting option And This is the estimated_mau returned by FB Delivery Estimate API for the spec consisting just the attributes in that entity (group) And with addition of each attribute to the group ,the call will be made and MAU will be updated on UI along with corresponding venn diagram And with deletion of any attribute, the corresponding MAU will be updated from UI And addition of any atrribute to existing mapped attribute, this will turn to grouped entity and MAU will be fetched accordingly

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-51 | Audience Mapping | Audience Size - Complete collection of FB Targetting option
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to should be able to see audience size corresponding to entire FB targetting option
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results
  6. User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors

testScript.details: Given User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors Then System will attempt to get the delivery estimate (reach) of complete collection of facebook targeting options corresponding to a target audience (on the mapping module). And This is the estimated_mau returned by FB Delivery Estimate API for the spec consisting just the attributes in that full target-audience And with addition of each attribute to the group ,the call will be made and MAU of entire targetting option will be updated on UI along with corresponding venn diagram And with deletion of any attribute, the corresponding and MAU of entire targetting option will be updated from UI And deletion of entire mapping , audience size of TA will be set to 0 And addition of any atrribute to existing mapped attribute, this will turn to grouped entity and MAU of entire targetting option will be fetched accordingly

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-51 | Audience Mapping | Audience Size - Version
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to should be able to see audience size corresponding to entire version
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results
  6. User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors

testScript.details: Given User has created collection of facebook target options corresponding to business attributes of target audience for whom the mapping process was initiated using AND/OR connectors Then System will attempt to get the delivery estimate (reach) of the audience version (on the control bar). And It is the sum of âaudience-sizeâ of each target-audience within the given version. And with addition of each attribute to any version at individual or group level,the call will be made and MAU of entire version will be updated on UI along with corresponding venn diagram And with deletion of any attribute at individual or group level,the call will be made and MAU of entire version will be updated on UI And on deletion of entire mapping across all target audience ,audience size of version should be set to 0

testCase.name: FCBK-1200 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Base Project "Rules section" section

  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And user on click Recommendation Tab User must be able to see Base Project And user click on desired base project card out of listed base project cards Then User will be redirected to a landing page where they will be able to see details of the base project. And on the details page, user will be able to see base project overview accordion. And Below the accordion, there will be Configuration section & section to select video. But, there should not be any Rule Section visible. And User Selected video, Rules section associated with the selected video should become visible. And User Selected another video, Rules section should be updated with associated rules of newly selected video. And As soon as rules section is visible, a banner asking the user to save the baseÂ project as recommendation should be displayed with CTA as OK and save now. And If the user selects Ok the banner will close and user will be able to continue as they were doing before And If user tries to interact with rules,Â banner asking the user to save the baseÂ project as recommendation should be displayed again. And If the user selects save now, user should be allowed to save the base project as recommendation and move to Save recommendation tab.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-332 | Creator landing page - layout and structure
testCase.objective: To validate layout and structure for creator landing page
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and redirected to creator landing page Then On creator landing page user will be able to see bread crumbs and user controls on the top. And audience cards will be displayed in order of latest first And cards will be displayed in 5x2 grid. And Search and sort functionality will be present

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-332 | Creator landing page - layout and structure | cards details
testCase.objective: To validate  cards placement creator landing page
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and redirected to creator landing page Then audience cards will be displayed in order of latest first And cards will be displayed in 5x2 grid. And if there are more than 10 cards, pagination will be present And each card at top will have copy, delete and lock icon And name of editer with timestamp will be present in next line And name of audience must be present in the next line And campaign id must be present for all cards apart from one in draft state And Facebook audience no must be present for all cards apart from one in draft state

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-333 | Creator landing page | add new campaign
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to add new campaign
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on CTA to add new campaign objective Then User will be shown a pop up where they need to fill in details to create campaign objective and upload corresponding survey data. And On the pop user will be able to add campaign objective name (Max 300 chars), Source survey data file display name (Max 50 chars,), CTA to browse and upload survey data file And CTA to download survey data file template must be present And Checkbox to indicate if the audience is demo audience And Pop up will have a Create CTA. This create CTA will create a audience entity at the backend and its resulting card will be created and displayed on landing page And Status of such audience will be draft and same will be displayed on the corresponding audience card. And Pop will also have Cancel and "x" CTA to close the pop. Clicking on these CTA will close the pop up without creating a new audience entity at the backend and its resulting card to be displayed on landing page.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-333 | Creator landing pag | add new campaign - file validation
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to validate survey data file while campaign creation
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on CTA to add new campaign objective Then User will be shown a pop up where they need to fill in details to create campaign objective and upload corresponding survey data. And survey data file uploaded must be validated for format and size And in case validation fails, user will be shown the error message And campaign objective creation must fail

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-333 | Creator landing page | add new campaign - cancel and cross button
testCase.objective: To validate functionality of  cancel or cross on create popup
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on CTA to add new campaign objective Then after user clicks on cross button or cancel CTA, data won't be saved And pop up must disappear And CTA to add new campaign must be enabled

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-336 | Creator tab | add audience version
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to add new audience version
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on audience card in draft state Then User will be redirected to Create tab of the journey and will be able to see a CTA "New" next to audience version selector drop down. And pop up to add new version will be opened And user will be able to provide audience version name (Max 50 chars) And Add CTA will be activated after atleast one audience version name has been added on the pop up. And user will also be able to see a "+" sign which will incrementally allow user to add more audience versions Maximum 10 audience versions can be created within a campaign objective And clicking on ADD CTA will save the audience version to objective

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-337 | Creator tab | target audience | detail
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to view details of the target audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA
  5. User has selected a audience version

testScript.details: Given user has created a audience version and addded target audiences to it Then User will be able to see target audiences listed in the left most column in order of updated desc And Each target audience in the list will be listed in compressed state by default and will have a + sign to expand to display the list of business attributes added to it And + will be replaced by - once the user has expanded and target audience and clicking on it will compress it And if a target audience doesn't have any business attribute added, then only its name will be displayed and once business attributes are added to it +/- sign will appear against it to expand or compress it.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-337 | Creator tab | Audience version selector | NEW
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to create a new audience version by clicking on new button
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA
  5. User has clicked on an audience card irrespective of the status

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on an audience card Then user must be able to see NEW button along with version dropdown And on clicking on new button, pop up to add new version must be shown And Once created they will available within the drop down and user can select them to continue the create journey.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-337 | Creator landing page | Audience version selector | state other than draft
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to audience version selector for state other than draft
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA
  5. User has clicked on an audience card which is in state other than draft

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on an audience card Then User will be able to see the name of most recently created audience version name pre populated in the drop down. Other options in the drop down are also sorted by their creation date/time stamp with latest shown first. And user will not be allowed to add an audience version using "new" CTA And Target audience corresponding to the audience version will be listed down in read only format.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-338 | Creator page | target audience | limit
testCase.objective: To validate max of 10 target audience can be created within a version
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA
  5. User has selected a audience version

testScript.details: Given user has created a audience version Then User will be able to see the cta with plus icon to add a new target audience And on clicking on the CTA pop up with heading Add audience target must be shown And max of 10 target audience can be created And on addition of new targets more than 10 will result in error

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-337 | Creator landing page | target audience | lock
testCase.objective: To validate functionality of the target audience view in locked state
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA
  5. User has selected a audience version

testScript.details: Given user has created a audience version and addded target audiences to it Then If a target audience has been locked by a user during the mapping it would appear in a locked state with a CTA to navigate to map journey to the step where they can unlock it. And In a locked state user will not be allowed to edit the target audience but only view it in read only mode.

testCase.name: FCBK-1283 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Transition from Base Recommendation to Saved Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate the transition from Base Recommendation to Saved Recommendation
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel
  5. User select a config on Base project and click on "Save Now" button after selecting a video (or keep Higest KPI default video selected)

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Base Project And User select a config on Base project and click on "Save Now" button after selecting a video (or keep Higest KPI default video selected) Then Base Recommendation will convert into Saved Recommendtaion without closing page i.e. Once the user saves successfully, the copy of base project entity in backend should be saved as recommendation and any further updates to the recommendation should be updated within the saved recommendation entity from that point onwards. This action should also create a saved recommendation card under saved recommendation tab in the draft state. And user will be able to edit or add rules, based on which numbers in recommendation overview module shown within step 3 and overall recommendation overview accordion above step configuration selector should be updated. The saved recommendation card should also display the updated numbers on the rules landing page. And the selected video to be sent for approval will also not get updated until the user edits and saves the rules for the selection. And user will now be able to see the send for approval CTA at the bottom through which they will be able to initiate the approval process. And Back CTA available on this screen at the bottom will take the user back to Rules landing page.

  6. User Click on "Send for Approval" for a saved recommendation.

testCase.name: FCBK-1203 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Send for Approval | Approval screen
testCase.objective: Validate approval screen contents
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User click on "Send for Approval" button Then Once the user clicks on send for approval CTA, user will be able to see send for approval screen. And Send for approval screen will have have two section - approval request and summary of approval. User will be allowed to switch between two sections. And Approval request will screen will allow user to select the approver from a drop down. In the drop down user will be able to see the list of approvers - users having the role creative approver assigned to them. And User will also be able to subscribe to notification emails for the approval request. And In this section user will be able to send the recommendation for approval by clicking on CTA send for approval. This will close the screen and take the user back to saved recommendation which is now in "Approval request sent" state.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User make changes in rules And User Send request for Approval And Clicking on History CTA will redirect user to history screen And History screen will have two sections - history and changes. History screen will also display the current status of the recommendation. And Under history section user will be able to see entries for Approval request sent. And Each entry will also show the date and time stamp along with user who it was sent to approval And Under changes sectionÂ user will be able to see the list of configurations in a collapsed accordion format.Â And In collapsed state each configuration will display the number of rules edited, removed and added. And In case the default selection was sent for approval accordion will say the accordion will display "no changes were made". And In case if the selection was updated and no rule was edited, relaxed and added it will be displayed accordingly And When the accordion is expanded, user will be able to see the details of each rule which was edited, relaxed and added. And User will be able to collapse the accordion back again. And User will be able to close the screen by clicking on the "x".

testCase.name: FCBK-1289 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Saved Recommendation | Recommendation in Approved state

  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

  7. Approver, Approves the request.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User click on "Send for Approval" button And Approver, Aproves the request Then User will be able to access the saved recommendation in read only format with its status displayed on top And step 2 instead of being called select a video will be called as sample video. And Instead of top 6 videos only the sample video which was approved for the config will be displayed. And Screen will also display the states of life cycle recommendation has completed - launched as project, And Approved with approver name, date and time of approval at the bottom And Go to project CTA. And back button will allow the user to go back to rules landing page.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User click on "Send for Approval" button Then User will be able to see history CTA on the recommendations details page for all the subsequent states. And Clicking on History CTA will redirect user to history screen And History screen will have two sections - history and changes. History screen will also display the current status of the recommendation. And Under history section user will be able to see entries for Approval request sent. And User will be able to close the screen by clicking on the "x".

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User click on "Send for Approval" button Then User will be able to see history CTA on the recommendations details page for all the subsequent states. And Clicking on History CTA will redirect user to history screen And History screen will have two sections - history and changes. History screen will also display the current status of the recommendation. And Under history section user will be able to see entries for Approval request sent. And User cancel the Approval request And For a recommendation which has been sent for approval, if the approval request is cancelled, the entry sent for approval should be removed from history. And As Audit trail of the requets raised will be removed, since this was only request History CTA will also be gone And User will be able to close the screen by clicking on the "x".

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Geo Location | Control Bar
testCase.objective: To validate control bar wherein user can  Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform . Then User will be able to see activated geo location configurator in control bar. And For an audience which doesn't have a geo location selected yet, in the geo configurator "selection in progress" should be displayed And View all CTA and edit CTA should be deactivated.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-367 | Audience Mapping | Gender and age Filter
testCase.objective: Validate user is able to access a control bar with controls and widgets to customize the audience mapping process.
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience they want to map.

testScript.details: Given User will be able to select the age and gender filters in the rightmost panel. And For gender user will be able to select one from - All genders, male, female. By default all genders will be selected. And Users will be also able to select the age range by selecting the lower (default 13) and upper age (default 65+) limit through drop downs. And user will be able to finalize their selection for gender and age by clicking on Confirm selection CTA for the selected target audience. Clicking this CTA will also collapse the sub panel for selecting the gender and age filters. user will be able to continue with the mapping for target audience by selecting a business attribute. And Once the user has finalized the gender and age filters, while selecting the business attributes for the target audience any attribute related to gender and age should be identified by the system. And As soon as the user clicks on any such business attribute user should be show a pop telling them that they have selected a gender or age related attribute for which they can set the values through the gender and age filters available on the right most panel. And User will be also allowed to generate recommendations for such an attribute and in case system doesn't generate any recommendation, appropriate message should be shown on the screen.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-339 | Creator Tab | target audience |Adding business attribute : Edit
testCase.objective: To validate that added  business attribute can be removed by clicking on cross icon
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client 
  3. For an unlocked target audience, User has clicked on step 3 question responses displayed for a question in survey data

testScript.details: Given Responses get added to the target audience as business attribute. Then User can remove a business attribute by deselecting the corresponding response in survey data module or by clicking the X icon against each business attribute in target audience. And Based on the business attribute added to the target audience, total number of survey respondents should be displayed for each target audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-338 | Creator Tab | Display survey data
testCase.objective: To validate survey data added is displayed on the create tab for a target audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. User has selected a target audience under an audience version

testScript.details: Given User has selected a target audience under an audience version Then For a target audience which has no business attributes added to it, survey data should be displayed to the user incrementally using below 3 steps And Step 1: user should be able to select the parameter the based on which they want to split the data from a drop down And Step 2: Based on the parameter selected in step 1, user should be shown % break up of responses to the question pertaining to the parameter. User should be allowed to select multiple responses. And Step 3: Based on the response(s) selected in step 2, % break up of responses for all other questions in the survey should be filtered and displayed in sequence they are listed in the original survey. And In step 3, user should be allowed to select the response(s) displayed for a question and once the response(s) is selected, it should act as a filter for all other questions displayed in step 3 and %ges should get updated And Change in selection in step1 should make the user go through entire step 2 ad 3. And Change in selection in step 2, should update %ges and reset selections in step 3. And Change in selection in step 3 for any of the question, should update %ges and reset selections for all the subsequent questions. And User should be allowed to collapse and expand step 1 and 2. For step 3 all questions should be collapsible and expandable. And For a target audience which already has business attributes, the survey data should display the final state of step 1, 2 and 3 which was used to add business attributes.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached | Configurations
testCase.objective: To validate 2 step configuration is present  wherein user can  Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User will be able to see activated geo location configurator in control bar. Then Below control bar user will be able to see two steps required for configuring the geo location along with Map attributes CTA in deactivated state And first configuration should be Select the audience's target area And second configuration should be Find countries and region And Step 2 only become activated after user has completed step 1

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached | Step 1 definations
testCase.objective: To validate selectable values under step 1 n 2
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User has landed on activated geo location configurator Then In step 1 user will be able to select audiences target area. And Values would be fetched from facebook and would be shown in a drop down as shown in designs. And By default first value would be in selected state.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached | Step 2 definations
testCase.objective: To validate selectable values under step 2
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User has landed on activated geo location configurator Then In step 2, user will be able to include/exclude multiple groups of Continent (level - L1), countries (level - L2) and cities (level - L3) by searching their names or browsing the list fetched from facebook. And User will not be allowed to exclude at any level without having an entity included at the higher level. And If the user includes an entity at country or city level it should get merged into the continent or country level (if it exists) respectively with appropriate on screen message with a CTA to undo the action And User should be allowed to remove the entities at continent, country or city level. This action should also remove any excluded country or city listed at lower level with appropriate on screen message with a CTA to undo the action. And When the user is selecting the continent, countries or cities through browse list user will be allowed to select a complete continent, country or city. Any selection made here would also update the list in #5. User will be able to expand/collapse continents and countries to view countries and cities mapped under them respectively.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Geo Location | Display after selection
testCase.objective: To validate values displayed after selection
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User has landed on activated geo location configurator and selected all the geo levels Then Based on the continent, countries and cities selected, user will be able to see them included or excluded on a map. this map will get updated as the user includes and excludes continents, countries and cities. And Once the user has minimum one continent, country or city included in step 2, highest level entity in each group of continent, country and city should be shown as comma separated value in geo configurator in control bar And User should now also be able to click on Map attribute CTA which should redirect user to the screen where they would be able to select a target audience and continue with mapping.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-604 | Select geo location for audience version with no geolocation attached | View All n Edit All CTA
testCase.objective: To validate activation of view all n edit all cta
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version and target
  4. User has clicked on Continue CTA after selecting the platform .

testScript.details: Given User has landed on activated geo location configurator and selected all the geo levels Then View all CTA would be activated once user has finished selecting the geo location and once clicked user will be able to see the list of countries included and corresponding cities excluded under them. And Edit CTA would be activated after user has finished selecting the geo location and now moved further in the mapping journey. Clicking on edit would open the step 1 & 2 and will allow user to update the geo location.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And User click on "Send for Approval" button Then User will be able to see history CTA on the recommendations details page for all the subsequent states. And Clicking on History CTA will redirect user to history screen And History screen will have two sections - history and changes. History screen will also display the current status of the recommendation. And Under history section user will be able to see entries for Approval request sent. And user change the Approver (cancel request >> select diffrent approver from list >> send) And Under history section user will be able to see entries for Approval request sent (Approver changed). And Entry will also show the date and time stamp along with user who it was sent for approval. And User will be able to close the screen by clicking on the "x".

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on an audience card and created a audienceversion with no target audience and clicked on copy icon Then User will be shown a pop up to rename the audience version name (char limit should be same as while creating a new audience version) And User will be able to cancel or close the pop up without making any changes. And Once the user has provided the name and has clicked on confirm, the audience version selected will be copied with no target audience And The new audience version will be available within the audience version selector drop down. user will be able to select it and continue with the journey.
