testCase.name: WKFLFB2-508 | Manage Target Audience Group within a version
testCase.objective: To validate user can mange / delete the target audience group for a selected version
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version

testScript.details: Given User has selected an audience version for a draft audience Then User will now be able to see manage target audience CTA if there are target audience available within the selected audience version And Once user clicks on the CTA, pop up allowing user to manage the target audience should open. And On the pop up, user should be able to see the list of available target audiences within the audience version. And Users should be able to select target audience for deletion which are not locked by the user while completing the mapping journey. Once at least one target audience is selected for deletion, confirm button should get activated clicking which should delete the target audience And User should be able to close the pop up without making any changes by cancel CTA or X icon.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-508 | Manage Target Audience Group within a version | Locked Group
testCase.objective: To validate user cannot delete delete the target audience group for a selected version which is  in locked state
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version

testScript.details: Given User has selected an audience version for a draft audience Then User will now be able to see manage target audience CTA if there are target audience available within the selected audience version And Once user clicks on the CTA, pop up allowing user to manage the target audience should open. And On the pop up, user should be able to see the list of available target audiences within the audience version. with locked target audience with locked icon And Users should be able to select target audience for deletion which are not locked by the user while completing the mapping journey. And all selected groups should be delete apart from locked

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-367 | Audience Mapping | Age n Gender Filter
testCase.objective: Validate functionality for age and gender filter
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has selected the target audience they want to map.

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience which is to be mapped Then User will be able to select the age and gender filters in the rightmost panel. And For gender user will be able to select one from - All genders, male, female. By default all genders will be selected. And Users will be also able to select the age range by selecting the lower (default 13) and upper age (default 65+) limit through drop downs. And user will be able to finalize their selection for gender and age by clicking on Confirm selection CTA for the selected target audience. And Clicking this CTA will also collapse the sub panel for selecting the gender and age filters. user will be able to continue with the mapping for target audience by selecting a business attribute.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-367 | Audience Mapping | Age n Gender Filter | Cancel
testCase.objective: Validate functionality for age and gender filter values don't persists when user clicks on cancel
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has selected the target audience they want to map.

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience which is to be mapped and selected age and gender filters and some values in it And user clicks on CANCEL CTA after selecting values Then age and gender filter must be reset to default values

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-367 | Audience Mapping | Age n Gender Related attribute
testCase.objective: Validate functionality for identifying age and gender related filters
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has selected the target audience they want to map.

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience which is to be mapped Then while selecting the business attributes for the target audience any attribute related to gender and age should be identified by the system. And As soon as the user clicks on any such business attribute user should be show a pop telling them that they have selected a gender or age related attribute for which they can set the values through the gender and age filters available on the right most panel And clicking on OK, there should be no recommendation generated but user can still select age and gender filter

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-367 | Audience Mapping | Age n Gender Related attribute | generate Recommendation
testCase.objective: Validate functionality for generating recommendations for age and gender related attribute
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has selected the target audience they want to map.

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience which is to be mapped Then while selecting the business attributes for the target audience any attribute related to gender and age should be identified by the system. And As soon as the user clicks on any such business attribute user should be show a pop telling them that they have selected a gender or age related attribute for which they can set the values through the gender and age filters available on the right most panel And clicking on "GENERATE RECOMMNDATIONS", User will be also allowed to generate recommendations for such an attribute and in case system doesn't generate any recommendation, appropriate message should be shown on the screen.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-503 | Creator landing page - layout and structure | card controls - DELETE
testCase.objective: To validate delete controls present on cards
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and redirected to creator landing page and cards are present Then each audience card will Delete control : available on the cards of all statuses (except for status "draft locked - in use" ) And for draft in lock cards this icon would be in disabled state). And If user clicks on it , user will be shjown a pop up to confirm the deletion And on confirming the underlying audience entity and card will get deleted. And page will get refreshed and card won't be present on landing page

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-503 | Creator landing page - layout and structure | card controls - COPY
testCase.objective: <u></u>To validate copy controls present on cards
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and redirected to creator landing page and cards are present Then each audience card will Copy control : available on the cards of all statuses (except for status ""imported from facebook" ) And If user clicks on this card, user should be shown a pop up duplicate audience and allowed to put a new audience name and click on save CTA, And cancel CTA or 'X' will close the pop up without making any changes. And This action will create a copy of underlying audience (irrespective of its state) in draft state and create a corresponding card. And User should be able to interact with newly created audience as an audience in draft state irrespective of parent card status with version, audience group and mapping copied And Audience version (if locked in parent card) will be copied as Incomplete in the copied card And last edited by name should be the name of the person who has copied

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-503 | Creator landing page - layout and structure | card controls - LOCK
testCase.objective: To validate LOCK control present on cards
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and redirected to creator landing page and cards are present Then each audience card will Lock icon present And for cards in use by some other user , LOCK icon will be enabled And cards will be shown with status "draft locked - in use". And If user tries to click open any such audience card they should be show a tool tip with message as in designs And in case user is on the page and clicks on the card (which is in use by some other user), the toast message "card is in use" must be displayed and page must refresh And on refresh the locked state of the card must be shown

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-510 | Creator Tab | Map DSP as FACEBOOK by default
testCase.objective: To validate DSP Audience is set to FACEBOOK for all versions
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. User has selected a target audience under an audience version

testScript.details: Given For a draft audience, user has selected the audience version and has created at least one target audience with minimum one business attribute Then Map tab should get activated. And User once they click on map, user should be able see Audience platform name default selection as facebook and Continue CTA. And Once the user clicks on continue CTA, Audience version platform name as FACEBOOK should get populated in the control bar And Also, after the user clicks on continue CTA, geo configurator should get active and user should be allowed to select the geo location

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-524 | Copy Audience Version | Create Tab
testCase.objective: To validate user can create a copy of audience versiob
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version

testScript.details: Given User has selected an audience version for a draft audience Then User must be able to see a copy CTA next to it And on clicking on it User will be shown a pop up to rename the audience version name with char limit as 50 char. Default name should be "copy of previous name" And Once the user has provided the name and has clicked on confirm, the audience version selected within the audience version selector with all the target audience and business attributes will be copied under the new audience version name. And The new audience version will be available within the audience version selector drop down. user will be able to select it and continue withÂ the journey.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-524 | Copy Audience Version | Map Tab
testCase.objective: To validate user can create a copy of audience version from map tab
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has selected audince version

testScript.details: Given User has selected an audience version for a draft audience and navigate to map tab Then User must be able to see a copy CTA next to it And on clicking on it User will be shown a pop up to rename the audience version name with char limit as 50 char. Default name should be "copy of previous name" And Once the user has provided the name and has clicked on confirm, user will be redirected to create tab And the audience version selected within the audience version selector with all the target audience and business attributes will be copied under the new audience version name. And The new audience version will be available within the audience version selector drop down. user will be able to select it and continue withÂ the journey And mapping will be removed

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-506| Duplicate Name not allowed for audience version, target audience and campaign objective
testCase.objective: To validate that Duplicate Name arenot allowed for audience version, target audience and campaign objective
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client

testScript.details: Given user has access to creator module Then while creating objectives, if user enters the name of existing non deleted objective, error message and objective shouldn't be created And while creating versions one by one, if user enters the name of existing non deleted versions, error message and versions shouldn't be created And while creating versions in same modal window, if user enters the name of existing non deleted versions, error message and versions shouldn't be created And while creating target one by one, if user enters the name of existing non deleted target, error message and versions shouldn't be created And while creating target in same modal window, if user enters the name of existing non deleted target, error message and versions shouldn't be created

1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography

testScript.details: Given User has created a audience, version, target audience Then On the audience card - user should be allowed to edit the audience name for draft (not on locked) and approved audience And On the create tab - user should be allowed to edit the audience name, audience version name and target audience name for draft (not on locked) and approved audience And On the map tab - user should be allowed to edit the audience name, audience version name and target audience name for draft (not on locked) and approved audience And Clicking on the edit CTA should open a pop up to input the new name And user should be able to close or cancel the pop up using X or cancel without making any changes And User should not be allowed to save any name without providing any value.

  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. User has selected a target audience under an audience version

testScript.details: Given For an unlocked target audience, User has clicked on step 3 question responses displayed for a question in survey data Then Responses get added to the target audience as business attribute. And User can remove a business attribute by deselecting the corresponding response in survey data module or by clicking the X icon against each business attribute in target audience. And Based on the business attribute added to the target audience, total number of survey respondents should be displayed for each target audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-595| Creator landing page | add new campaign demo audience
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to add new demo campaign
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on CTA to add new campaign objective Then If the user chooses to create target audience then demo audience survey data file should get automatically uploaded. user will be able to download the file template provided by DCE specifically for the demo audience. And ser still has to provide audience name and source survey data file display name. And User will be able to upload the demo audience file downloaded in step 2 after making changes to it. Once the file gets uploaded "Create" CTA should get activated. User will also have the capability to remove the file. And On click of create, system should check the uploaded files if it meets all the criteria set for a demo audience file. this is an existing module and need not be developed but integrated into this pop up. And In case of error in step 5, error message should be displayed below uploaded file, pop up will stay open. User will have the option to reupload the file or close the pop up. And Once there are no errors with the file after clicking on create CTA, user will be able to see demo audience card on creator landing page. Status of the card will be same as regular audience with "Demo audience" prefixed.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-493| Creator landing page | Processing of new audience creation
testCase.objective: To validate functionality of processing of survey data while creating new adudience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on creator tab in left pane and clicked on CTA to add new campaign objective and entered all details and submitted Then user will be shown a toast message is shown with "will send mail once processing is over" . And and card would not be shown. And once the user gets successful email message and refreshes the landing page, card can be viewed.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-624| Audience Mapping | Handling Rate limiting while fetching delivery estimates from Facebook
testCase.objective: Validate functionality in case of error while fetching delivery estimates from FB
testCase.precondition:
1. User should be logged in as client executive
  2. User has successfully created an audience version with target audience and business attributes for a campaign objective
  3. User has successfully selected the geolocation for audience version
  4. User has selected the target audience and can now see the list of associated business attributes 
  5. User has now generated the recommended facebook target options and search results

testScript.details: Given User has selected the target audience and User is now dragging and dropping recommended facebook target option and custom search results into the rightmost panel below control bar. Then while creating mapping in case of error from FB while fetching estimates, on ui an error icon will be shown And numbers will be fetched after retrying to fetch estimates again

testCase.name: FCBK-1283 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations tab Landing Page | Saved recommendation | changes in rule should be reflected in video KPI
testCase.objective: Validate that Saved recommendation card will display name of the base project, display image, primary metric (in our case it will be VCR) along with the delta improvement and arrow indicator (green and upwards for positive; red and downward for negative), duration of the primary project, facebook log, category of card ie "base project" and colored indicator to denote base project. Clicking on this card will navigate user to base project recommendation landing page.
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations Then user must be able to see Recommendation tab in the left navigation panel And on clicking Recommendation Tab User must be able to see Saved Recommendation And Saved recommendation card will display name of the base project, display image, primary metric (in our case it will be VCR) along with the delta improvement and arrow indicator (green and upwards for positive; red and downward for negative), duration of the primary project, facebook log, category of card ie "base project" and colored indicator to denote base project. Clicking on this card will navigate user to base project recommendation landing page.

testCase.name: To create target audience

step.description:
Hit the api

URL
POST- {{host}}/api/audience/recommendation/objectives/:objectiveId/versions/:versionId/targetAudience
 
Sample PARAM: Path Variables
  objectiveId:"6050790d9403a31804dbf1c9"
versionid:"605dfad8b86c60989415320e "

Headers
Content-Type: application/json
x-access-token: <token>

Request Body
{
"audiences":["ta1","ya2"]
}
step.testData: this will create audience target for a version provided all values given in body is unique

testCase.name: FCBK-1203 | FCBK-23 | Recommendations | Send for Approval summary of approval | Approval request sent after previous was cancelled
testCase.objective: Validate Send for Approval summary of approval contents Approval request sent after previous was cancelled
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view recommendations.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate recommendations for the campaign.
  4. User has clicked on recommendations tab in left navigation panel
  5. User already Saved a recommendation from base Project
  6. User Click on "Send for Approval" for a saved recommendation.

testScript.details: Given a user logs in DCE platform And user has valid roles and authorization And a campaign is associated to user in completed state And the completed campaign has recommendations And User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And user Navigates Recommendation >> Rules >> Saved Project And user edit rules and send request for approval but then user cancel it And User make changes in rules And User click on "Send for Approval" button Then Once the user clicks on send for approval CTA, user will be able to see send for approval screen. And Send for approval screen will have have two section - approval request and summary of approval. User will be allowed to switch between two sections. And In the summary of approval section , user will be able to see the list of configurations in a collapsed accordion format. And In collapsed state, each configuration will display the number of rules edited, removed and added. And In case the default selection was sent for approval the accordion will display "no changes were made". And In case if the selection was updated and no rule was edited, relaxed and added it will be displayed accordingly. And When the accordion is expanded, user will be able to see the details of each rule which was edited, relaxed and added. And User will be able to collapse the accordion back again. And User will be able to close the screen without sending the recommendation for approval by clicking on the "x".

testCase.name: FCBK-1518 | Creative narrative | Display a banner as a reminder once user rearranges the segment within a narrative
testCase.objective: Validate that Banner will be triggered every time a segment is rearranged.
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given User is logged in. And User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project. And User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign. And User Navigate to Creative Narrative, Project >> Creative Model >> Creative Narravite And User has rearranged the segments of a narrative. Then User will be prompted to review the timeline through a banner. And Banner reads "Reminder: Please review the timeline of the segments after re ordering segments" And User will be able to clear the banner by clicking on OK CTA. And Banner will be triggered every time a segment is rearranged. And User will be able to continue rearranging multiple segments while the banner is open and can close the banner by clicking OK once they have rearranged all the segments.

And User Navigate to Creative Narrative, Project >> Creative Model >> Creative Narravite Then User will be able to see "+ click to add creative narrative for a project" CTA (for new project with no pre existing creative narrative set for the project) And User click on '+' CTA and add narrative for project And user now should not see "+ click to add creative narrative for a project" CTA And user now should see "click to add alternate duration" CTA below the narrative.

testCase.name: FCBK-1515 | Creative narrative | Duration engine will recommend durations as per Creative narratives of different durations which are created and displayed on this screen
testCase.objective: Validate that Creative narratives of different durations which are created and displayed on this screen will also dictate what durations can be recommended later by the durations engine.
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given User is logged in. And User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project. And User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign. And User Navigate to Creative Narrative, Project >> Creative Model >> Creative Narravite Then User will be able to see "+ click to add creative narrative for a project" CTA (for new project with no pre existing creative narrative set for the project) And User click on '+' CTA and add narrative for project And user add more durations using "click to add alternate duration" CTA below the narrative. And Creative narratives of different durations which are created and displayed on this screen will also dictate what durations can be recommended later by the durations engine. for eg if there three narratives of duration 20s, 15s and 10s are configured for a project then the duration engine will recommend durations of 20s, 15s and 10s only and corresponding duration will be displayed. And Screens should be realinged as per design while narrative is not added, while adding narrative, and while narrative is added

testCase.name: FCBK-1516 | Creative narrative | Add segment - timeline
testCase.objective: Validate the Add segment pop up updates
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign.

testScript.details: Given User is logged in. And User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project. And User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign. And User Navigate to Creative Narrative, Project >> Creative Model >> Creative Narravite Then User click on '+' CTA and add narrative for project And User will be able to see Add Segment CTA once Narraive is added And If the user is trying to create the first narrative within the project, narrative's name would be same as project. And Add segment pop up will appear once user click on Add segment And Show the blank timeline for entire narrative as per the designs. And By default 4 second timeline should be shown. And Allow user to increase the timeline for narrative using onscreen controls. And By default user will be able to gradually increase the timeline by 2 seconds. And Only after uploading the image/video, user should be allowed to specify the start and end time of the segment using begin and end sliders on the timeline. And Slider step size would be 0.1 seconds. And Display what the user has selected as start and end time of the segment.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-757| Audience version listing
testCase.objective: To validate condition for compare section to be enabled
testCase.precondition:
1. authorized user is logged in
  2. user has created an audience , version, target audiences, mapping
  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given User is redirected to audience version listing. Then User will be able to see all audience versions under the corresponding audience user is working. They will be displayed in closed accordion format by default. And Multiple audience versions can be in expanded state at any point of time. And Each audience version accordion while collapsed will display the name of audience version, date of creation, Thobal (need to confirm with Jasmine), number of survey respondents corresponding to the audience version, audience version size, Check box to select audience version for approval. chevron to expand/collapse accordion. And Send for approval CTA should be displayed. If no audience version is selected for approval this CTA should be disabled. And Send for approval CTA will redirect user to send for approval screens for audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-758| Audience Target Listing
testCase.objective: To validate user can view the target audiences for each version
testCase.precondition:
1. authorized user is logged in
  2. user has created an audience , version, target audiences, mapping
  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given All the target audiences within the audience version will be listed. Then Each target audience will have its name, date of creation, thobal (need to confirm with jasmine), survey respondents size, target audience size displayed. And Along with above each target audience will have an icon to display facebook target options mapped to the target audience. This CTA will be disabled for target audiences which are not locked in map. And Each target audience will also have edit CTA which will redirect user to map section of the journey with respective target audience selected in target audience selector. This CTA will be disabled for target audiences which are not locked in map. And Each target audience which has been locked in mapping will have check box to select the respective target audience for comparison, unblocked target audiences will have "map to compare" CTA which will redirect user to map. User will be able to select min 2 and max 5 target audience within an audience version for comparison. And Compare CTA will be displayed in disabled state until and unless user selects minimum 2 target audience for comparison. Compare CTA once enabled will redirect user to view the sankey chart comparison within the view port of accordion.

  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given User has selected min 2, max 5 target audiences to be compared and has clicked compare CTA within the audience version accordion. Then if user selects multiple target audience, comparision of all must be shown on right side as cumulative percentage and size And sankey chart will display the overlap of each target audience with others

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-806| Sankey Charts Rate Limiting
testCase.objective: To validate in case api rate limit is reached, error message is dispalyed on compare listing and sankey charts
testCase.precondition:
1. authorized user is logged in
  2. user has created an audience , version, target audiences, mapping
  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given api rate limit is reached and user is on compare tab Then user will be shown error sign against FB audience size in case size is not being fetched previously And on sankey charts section user will be given the message "we are unable to get info now , please try again later"

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-759| Compare Audience Target using Sankey charts | display
testCase.objective: To validate user is able to compare multiple target audiences of the audience version using sankey charts
testCase.precondition:
1. authorized user is logged in
  2. user has created an audience , version, target audiences, mapping
  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given User has selected min 2, max 5 target audiences to be compared and has clicked compare CTA within the audience version accordion. Then if user selects multiple target audience, on sankey charts overlap between 2 target audience pair of all the combination will be shown And on hovering over band respective audience size will be displayed

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-759| Compare Audience Target | Take Screenshots
testCase.objective: To validate user is able to take screenshots for the sankey charts
testCase.precondition:
1. authorized user is logged in
  2. user has created an audience , version, target audiences, mapping
  3. user has clicked on compare tab

testScript.details: Given User has selected min 2, max 5 target audiences to be compared and has clicked compare CTA within the audience version accordion. Then User would be able to Take Screenshot CTA And on clicking on it , a image will be downloaded with heading as objective name and survey audience size And Version name and sankey chart will be in the image as can be seen on the UI And even if multiple sankey charts are open, image of only the one for which take screenshot CTA is clicked will be in the image

testCase.name: FCBK-1636 | Duration based | Calendar drop down
testCase.objective: User will be able to see a calendar drop down to select the date for viewing the historical recommendation corresponding to date.
testCase.precondition:
1. User is logged in.
  2. User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project.
  3. User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign.
  4. User add crative narrative of multiple durations for project
  5. Each duration is mapped to composition in configuration section of project.

testScript.details: Given User is logged in. And User has access to the campaign for which they are trying to view Project. And User has been authorized to view and evaluate Project for the campaign. And User add crative narrative of multiple durations for project And Each duration is mapped to composition in configuration section of project. Then User Navigate to Creative Narrative, Project >> Duration based recommendations And User will be able to see "view recommendations history" CTA. And Once clicked, user will be able to redirected to historical recommendations in read only format (developed in phase 1) And Once one historical recommendation user will also have a "back to new recommendation" CTA to go back to the most recent duration based recommendation. And User will be able to see a calendar drop down to select the date for viewing the historical recommendation corresponding to date. User should not be allowed to select a future date. And User should not be allowed to select a date older than the first recommendation. And For any date which doesn't have a historical recommendation user should be shown a message that no recommendation exists. And User should also be allowed to navigate through all the historical recommendation sequentially from latest to last using previous and next controllers. And Previous and next should be deactivated on the first and last historical recommendation. And User should also be able to see the total number of historical recommendations and total number of recommendations he/she has viewed. And Based on the recommendation being viewed appropriate date should be reflected in calendar the drop down

testCase.name: FCBK-1455 | Notifications center Regular DCE user view | Notification when Approver rejects the request
testCase.objective: Validate the Approval Hub Notifications for Approver's view
testCase.precondition:
1. User already Saved a recommendation from base Project
  2. User Click on "Send for Approval" for a saved recommendation.
  3. Approver has received an "approval request" email
  4. Approver has clicked on the CTA to approve or reject on the email.

testScript.details: Given User already Saved a recommendation from base Project And User Click on "Send for Approval" for a saved recommendation. And Approver has received an "approval request" email And Approver rejects the approval request. Then Regular user will recive Approval Request Rejection Notification without refresh And red count will increase by one without refresh And notification will have Client logo And notification will have Date And notification will have Market And notification will have Campaing name And notification will have Project name And notification will have category And notification will have Status And notification will have View request CTA And Approval Request sent Notification will loss CTA

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-825 | Cancel audience approval CTA
testCase.objective: To validate the user is able to view cancel approval request for the audience which is approval pending state

testScript.details: Given an audience is in approval pending state Then user would be able to view CANCEL APPROVAL REQUEST CTA on compare TAB And on clicking on cancel cta a pop up to prompt user to change approver or cancel the request must appear

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-825 | Cancel audience approval Request | Change Approver
testCase.objective: To validate the user is able to change approver via cancel approval request for the audience which is approval pending state

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on cancel approval request CTA. Then On the pop up user should be able to select an alternate approver for the audience approval request through a drop down. All the users who have the client approver role assigned to them will be listed in this drop down. And Current approver's name should not be visible in the drop down. And If user selects an alternate name in the drop down then send CTA should become active. And User should also be allowed to indicate if they want to subscribe to updates regarding the audience approval request through a check box which will be available only after user has selected an alternate approver. And Send CTA should cancel the approval request sent to earlier approver, the email link sent in the email to previous approver should redirect user to an error message, And Send CTA should now send a new approval request to new approver selected in the drop down along with the new approval request email.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-825 | Cancel audience approval Request | Cancel Request
testCase.objective: To validate the user is able to cancel approval request for the audience which is approval pending state

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on cancel approval request CTA. Then User should also be allowed to skip sending the approval request to alternate approver and straight away cancel the approval request through "no thanks, just cancel the approval request" CTA. And "No Thanks ..." CTA should cancel the approval request sent to earlier approver, the email link sent to previous approver should redirect user to an error message. And If user is only cancelling the request and not sending it to alternate approver then the subscription indicated by user should be cleared. And SEND FOR APPROVAL cta should be active on the compare screen

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-823 | Send for approval CTA
testCase.objective: To validate the user is able to view Send for approval CTA on compare listing screen

testScript.details: Given an audience is eligible to be sent for approval Then user would be able to select versions to be sent for approval And Post selection, check boxes should convert to "selected to be sent for approval" for the corresponding audience versions. And Send approval request CTA should become available for the user as soon as at least one audience version is selected to be sent for approval. And User will be able to collapse/expand the audience version accordion and interact with it as earlier before the audience version was selected to be sent for approval.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-823 | Send for approval
testCase.objective: To validate the user is able to Send audiences for approval on compare listing screen

testScript.details: Given the user has sent the audience for approval Then the audience versions which were sent for approval they would have status as "Approval request sent" along with date, timestamp and approver name with an icon. And User will be able to expand/collapse the accordion and interact with it as earlier before the audience version was selected to be sent for approval with an exception that they will not be able to edit the audience version in any way by going to create or map. And Create and map step for these audience versions will become read only. And User would not be able to select any other audience version and send them again for approval without cancelling the approval request. And If the user has sent the audience for approval, the audience version which were not sent for approval for them the select for approval check box will become inactive. And User will be able to expand/collapse the accordion and interact with it as earlier before the audience version was selected to be sent for approval with an exception that they will not be able to edit the audience version in any way by going to create or map. And Create and map step for these audience versions will become read only. And Send for approval CTA will be replaced by Cancel approval request CTA.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-823 | Send for approval | effect on audience card
testCase.objective: To validate the audience sent for approval will be approval pending state

testScript.details: Given the user has sent the audience for approval Then For the audience which has been sent for approval, corresponding audience card will be in "Approval pending state". And Such card once clicked will redirect user to compare step of audience in read only mode. also create and map will be disabled for such audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-824 | Send for approval Pop Up
testCase.objective: To validate the send for approval popup

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on send for approval CTA. Then Send for approval pop up should be displayed. And On the pop up copy should be displayed as per design And On the pop up user will be able to select the approver from a dropdown list. In the drop down, users with client approver role will be listed. Client approver will be a new role which will allow users to approve or reject audience in approver's view and have view only access in regular view (similar to a client user role which is currently available in DCE which allows user to have view only access when logged) And Once user has selected the approver, they will be able to add an optional message for approver. And User should also be allowed to indicate if they want to subscribe to updates regarding the audience approval request through a check box which will be available only after user has selected an approver. And Once user has selected the approver, send for approval CTA should become available, clicking which all the audience version which were in selected state before send for approval CTA was clicked, will be sent for approval to the selected approver.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-832 | Notification email for audience approval request
testCase.objective: To validate Notification email is sent to approver selected for audience approval request

testScript.details: Given user has clicked on the "Send for approval" CTA on the send for approval pop up. Then A notification email should be sent to approver informing them of the new approval request being initiated. And the design of the mail should be as per design And mail should consist of CTA to view the approval request

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-833 | Notification email for audience approval request cancellation
testCase.objective: To validate Notification email is sent to previous approver and the the requester if subscribed

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on "no thanks ..." CTA on cancel approval request CTA Then Notification email should be sent to previous approver. Then Notification email should be sent to previous requester if they are subscribed. And the design of the mail should be as per design

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-937 | Notification email for audience approval request's approver change
testCase.objective: To validate Notification email sent in case of approver change

testScript.details: Given User has selected an alternate approver and has clicked on send CTA on cancellation pop up Then Notification email should be sent to previous approver. And Notification email should be sent to new approver. And Notification email should be sent to previous requester if they are subscribed. And Notification email should be sent to new requester if they have subscribed while sending the approval request to new approver. And mail should be as per design

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-935 | Subscription for receiving email notifications | Same user requesting and cancelling
testCase.objective: To validate Subscription flow for receiving email notifications

testScript.details: Given if the user has subscribed for updates on the send for approval pop up then they will receive all the notification email for that particular audience at each step ie being sent for approval, approval request cancelled, approver change, approved and finally linked to facebook. Then If it is the same user who raised the approval request and subscribed to it on send for approval pop up and now is cancelling it or changing approver on cancel approval request pop up and hasn't checked the subscription check box, user's subscription will end on the event of approval request cancellation or approver change. In these two events user will receive the last notification email informing them of the details regarding approval request cancellation or approver change.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-935 | Subscription for receiving email notifications | Different user requesting and cancelling
testCase.objective: To validate Subscription flow for receiving email notifications

testScript.details: Given User has opted for subscribing to updates for the audience Then If it is a different user (say X) than the user who raised the approval request (say Y) and subscribed to it on send for approval pop up and now X is cancelling it or changing approver on cancel approval request pop up and hasn't checked the subscription check box, then Y's subscription will end on the event of approval request cancellation or approver change. In these two events Y will receive the last notification email informing them of the details regarding approval request cancellation or approver change. And If it is a different user (say X) than the user who raised the approval request (say Y) and subscribed to it on send for approval pop up and now X is cancelling it or changing approver on cancel approval request pop up and has now checked the subscription check box, then Y's subscription will end on the event of approval request cancellation or approver change. In these two events Y will receive the last notification email informing them of the details regarding approval request cancellation or approver change. X will also start receiving notification emails as normal subscribed user.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-826 | Approver's view of audience approval request
testCase.objective: To validate the Approver's view of audience approval request

testScript.details: Given Approver has clicked on the approval request link they have received in the audience approval request notification email. Then Approver will be redirected to approvers view of the audience approval request. And Approver will be automatically logged in. And Approvers view of audience approval request will only display client name, heading, help section and copyright text as per design. Left navigation panel will only display DCE logo and client name. This panel will be collapsible. And Approvers view of audience approval request will display a heading as per deigns and customized dynamic message informing approver that "<user name> has requested sign off for the below audience request." And Approvers view of audience approval request will display audience objective name, number of survey respondents, survey data file name. And Approvers view of audience approval request will display comment/message added by the approval requester along with their user name and time stamp of when approval request was sent. And Approvers view of audience approval request will display all the audience versions and their subsequent target audiences which were sent for approval in an accordion in exactly the same way they are displayed for a regular user. Approver will not be able to edit the target audience in any way and in case designs have edit icon present then that needs to be removed.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-826 | Approver's view of audience approval request | Compare
testCase.objective: To validate the Approver's view of audience approval request compare section

testScript.details: Given Approver has clicked on the approval request link they have received in the audience approval request notification email. Then Approver will be redirected to approvers view of the audience approval request. And Approver will be able to compare the target audiences within an audience version in exactly the same way a regular user is able to compare min 2 and maximum 5 target audience using sankey charts.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-826 | Approver's view of audience approval request | Send Decision
testCase.objective: To validate the Approver ia bale to accept and reject the approval request per version

testScript.details: Given Approver has clicked on the approval request link they have received in the audience approval request notification email. Then Approver will be redirected to approvers view of the audience approval request. And Each audience version will have approve/reject CTA which will be visible in both collapsed and expanded state of audience version accordion and will mark the audience version and its underlying target audiences as approved or rejected respectively. And Approvers view of audience approval request will also display a Send decision CTA which will be activated after approver has approved or rejected each audience version which has been sent as part of approval request.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-828 | Review approval decision pop up for an approver
testCase.objective: To validate the Review approval decision pop up for an approver

testScript.details: Given Approver has clicked on send decision CTA after approving or rejecting all the audience versions which were sent in approval request. Then Review approval decision pop up should open. And Pop up should display the header as per design. And Approved versions will be grouped together under approved category. And Rejected versions will be grouped together under rejected category. And For each approved and rejected version approver will be able to add an message for the requester. This message will be optional. Max char 150. And Review approval decision pop up will also have a Send Decision CTA. Once an approver clicks on send decision CTA on pop up it should mark the approved and rejected audience versions accordingly at the back end. And Approver will be able to close the pop without taking any action by x icon.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-827 | Post decision approver's view of audience approval request
testCase.objective: To validate the Post decision approver's view of audience approval request

testScript.details: Given Approver has clicked on Send decision CTA on review decision pop up. Then Approver will be shown a thank you message as per designs And Approver will be informed about the next steps as per design. And In the next steps section, the requesters name will be dynamic and will be populated as per the approval request. And Approver will be shown "Log into DCE" CTA which will redirect user to DCE login

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1011| Link an approved audience to Facebook
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the functionality to Link an approved audience to Facebook

testScript.details: Given User has opened an approved audience. Then User will be redirected to compare section. And Approved audience along with all audience versions will be displayed in read only format. And User will be able to expand/contract the audience version accordions, compare target audiences within them using Sankey. All the features built as part of sankey charts need to be working. And Audience version which have been approved will be marked as approved according to design. And Audience version which have been rejected will be marked rejected. And Audience version which were not sent a part of approval request will have select for approval checkbox in disabled state against them. And Approved audience version will have Link CTA against them in activated state. "Only one approved audience version needs to be linked" this message needs to be added to compare screen when a user is viewing an approved audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1011| Link an approved audience to Facebook pop up
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the functionality to enter details in Link an approved audience to Facebook pop up

testScript.details: Given User has opened an approved audience. Then User will be redirected to compare section. And Approved audience along with all audience versions will be displayed in read only format. And User will be able to expand/contract the audience version accordions, compare target audiences within them using Sankey. All the features built as part of sankey charts need to be working. And Audience version which have been approved will be marked as approved according to design. And Audience version which have been rejected will be marked rejected. And Audience version which were not sent a part of approval request will have select for approval checkbox in disabled state against them. And Approved audience version will have Link CTA against them in activated state. "Only one approved audience version needs to be linked" this message needs to be added to compare screen when a user is viewing an approved audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-361| Access provided to DCE Admin role
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the access provided to dce-admin role

testScript.details: Given User has DCE admin role Then the will be admin users like SPI team who will be able to do both create an audience, map and compareand send them for approval to an approver (including themselves) and also approve them And They will have access admin portal under their DCE profile And Their name should come in the drop down while selecting an approver if they are provided client-approver access

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-361| Access provided to client Admin role
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the access provided to client admin role

testScript.details: Given User has DCE admin role Then these users will be from client side who will be able to create an audience,map and compare and send them for approval to an approver (including themselves) and also approve them. And They will not have access to admin portal under their DCE profile. And Their name should come in the drop down while selecting an approver if a client-approver role is provided to them

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-361| Access provided to client view role
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the access provided to client view role

testScript.details: Given User has client view role Then These users will be from client side and will be able to view any audience in read only mode. And If the audience is in draft state and doesn't have compare section enabled they will be restricted to create and map section in read only mode. And If the audience is in draft state and doesn't have compare and map section enabled they will be restricted to create section in read only mode. And Within compare section user will be able to do comparison only through sankey charts and download the snapshot and will not be able to send them for approval, cancel them in approval or link them to facebook. And They will not have access to admin portal under their DCE profile.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-361| Access provided to client approver
testCase.objective: 1. To validate the access provided to client approverrole

testScript.details: Given User has client approver role(This is a campaign level role to enable a client user who has a client approver profile to approve/reject audiences) Then For a user who needs approval privileges needs to have a client approver profile created and have this role assigned to them. And System admin will manually assign these roles and needs to be aware of whom this role needs to be assigned, as of now there is no check in the backend to prevent assigning this role to anyone. And user with this role will be shown in approiver list on send for approval popup

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1204| Duplicate Regular Audience | UI
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to duplicate regular audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on duplicate CTA on an audience card Then Duplicate audience pop up should open And User should be shown options to copy an audience without data repull and copy an audience with data repull. And If the user selects copy an audience with data repull, then user will be shown pop up specific for "duplicating an audience with repulled data file". And Disclaimer informing the user the limitations of repull ie new survey data file should be similar to the older file in terms of context and questionnaire structure should be displayed. If the audience becomes inconsistent after duplication user always has the option to delete and create anew audience as the parent audience remain untouched. And User will have to provide a unique audience name (all checks need to be performed vis a vis number of chars, uniqueness). And User will be able to include a new file from local file system or cloud location in exactly the same way they do while creating a new audienceor from cloud location And Template files will be shown to user for downloading and then uploading them through local upload as per the type of audience user is trying to duplicate with data repull. And Duplicate CTA will get activated once user has added the files. Before user clicks on Duplicate CTA, they will be allowed to go back to Duplicate audience pop up using back button and reinitiate the journey. Inputs provided by the user before clicking back button will not persist

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1204| Duplicate Demo Audience | UI
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to duplicate Demo audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on duplicate CTA on an audience card Then Duplicate audience pop up should open And User should be shown options to copy an audience without data repull and copy an audience with data repull. And If the user selects copy an audience with data repull, then user will be shown pop up specific for "duplicating an audience with repulled data file". And Disclaimer informing the user the limitations of repull ie new survey data file should be similar to the older file in terms of context and questionnaire structure should be displayed. If the audience becomes inconsistent after duplication user always has the option to delete and create anew audience as the parent audience remain untouched. And User will have to provide a unique audience name (all checks need to be performed vis a vis number of chars, uniqueness). And User will be able to include a new file from local file system in exactly the same way they do while creating a new audience And cta to upload file from cloud location will be disabled And Template files will be shown to user for downloading and then uploading them through local upload as per the type of audience user is trying to duplicate with data repull. And Duplicate CTA will get activated once user has added the files. Before user clicks on Duplicate CTA, they will be allowed to go back to Duplicate audience pop up using back button and reinitiate the journey. Inputs provided by the user before clicking back button will not persist

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1204| Duplicate Regular Audience | File from cloud location
testCase.objective: To validate functionality to uploacd file from cloud location while duplicating regular audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on duplicate CTA on an audience card Then Duplicate audience pop up should open And If the user selects copy an audience with data repull, then user will be shown pop up specific for "duplicating an audience with repulled data file". And User should be able to upload a file from local system by opening the file browser or dragging the file. File once added should be displayed. If the file has been successfully uploaded using local file upload cloud options should be disabled. User should be allowed to remove the file which will enable to cloud options And User should be able to click on icons for cloud services namely GCP, AWS and Public URL to initiate the journey for adding a file from cloud location. And If user clicks on GCP/AWS/public URL icon, user should be asked to provide Google, AWS or public URL (no other detail is required in case of public URL), upload private key JSON file through file browser or dragging the file to upload area in case of GCP or provide access id and access secret in case of AWS through a new pop up. Title of the pop up and a note should be shown to the user as per design. Once user adds the above details Add survey data CTA should become active. And Before user clicks on add survey data user will be allowed to go back to create new audience pop up using back button and reinitiate the journey. Inputs provided by the user before clicking back button will not persist. And Once user clicks on Add survey data in the backend connection should be established with Google cloud, authentication and authorization should be checked, validity of URL as well as file should be checked and then file should be fetched to DCE. If there is an error then a generic error should be shown. And If the file is successfully added then on the create new audience pop up file should be shown. Local file upload option should be disabled and cloud upload options should not be shown. User should be able to remove the file which will enable both local file and cloud options.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1204| Duplicate Demo Audience | Duplication BE Process
testCase.objective: To validate functionality of duplicating audience in BE
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on duplicate CTA on an audience card and entered all details and clicked on Duplicate CTA Then After clicking duplicate CTA a copy of parent audience should be created in the backend with create and mapping steps only (user will have to initiate the approval workflow again), as well as a corresponding audience card with new name provided above should be created. And For the new audience created in above step, there will be no change in the audience version and target audience composition or mapping of business attributes within target audiences to Facebook target options from parent audience. And After upload for a demo audience if all the targets audience and their business attributes change due to user uploading an entirely new file, then the new target audiences should not be locked in map section and previous targeting spec should be dropped. And For the new audience survey display module in create step now should show updated numbers as per the new survey data file added by the user. Survey display module should still show the responses in selected state as per the parent audience. And New audience created above should go from processing state to draft state and corresponding notification email should be sent to user as they are currently being done while creating a new audience.

testCase.name: WKFLFB2-1204| Duplicate Demo Audience | Duplication BE Process | Variations supported
testCase.objective: To validate variations supported while duplicating the audience
testCase.precondition:
1. user is logged in
  2. user is authorized to access creator module for the client and geography
  3. User has clicked on "Creator" module in left navigation panel
  4. user has clicked on "Add new campaign objective" CTA

testScript.details: Given User has clicked on duplicate CTA on an audience card and entered all details and clicked on Duplicate CTA Then in case user has just changed the size of audiences wrt net size and size at questions level, duplicated card should be consistent and invalid state And in case user has removed a attribute from the question or the entire question, duplicated card should be consistent and invalid state. attribute/question which was removed must not be shown or added in calcultaions And in case user has added a new question then the new q should be added in duplicated card in ignored state And if user uses the combination of above 3 variation then also card should be in valid state.

testCase.name: Api To Get approvers list
testCase.objective: Verify api To  Get approvers list

step.description:
Hit the api

URL
GET - {{host}}/api/brief/user/:briefId


 Headers
Content-Type: application/json
x-access-token: <token>
step.testData: Response will be return all the users with client-approver role under campiagn

testCase.name: Api To Send Approval Request
testCase.objective: Verify api To Send Approval Request

step.description:
Hit the api

URL
POST - {{host}}/api/audience/approval/objectives/:objectiveId/request


 Headers
Content-Type: application/json
x-access-token: <token>

Payload
{
    "versionIds":["60c07acfc742fc00f5a43874","60c07acfc742fc00f5a43873"],
    "approver":"60d37fbd1297c346cceb9c1a",
    "message":"Kindly have look",
    "isSubscribed":true
}
step.testData: Response will be return all status of the approval request made

testCase.name: Api To Cancel request for approval
testCase.objective: Verify api To Cancel request for approval

step.description:
Hit the api

URL
